commit_message:
Improve molecule testing of collect arguments

Adds test to ensure artcl_collect_list(_append) and
artcl_exclude_list(_append) collect and exclude files
as expected.

Change-Id: I1a6ff1f876bf2b355b8791959b945ae7c9fffeb9

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-08 17:12:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Tempest installtion on system wide for stable branch

INSTALL_TEMPEST flag enable to install Tempest by default on
devstack env which is meant for using on master gate only and has
to be false for stable branch. On stable branch master Tempest
on system wide can fail to install for various reason like constraint
etc. That is why we install Tempest on venv always.

This started failing the py2 jobs on stable/train gate[1] where
heat devstack plugin try to install Tempest on system wide also which try to
use py2 env (Tempest is py3 only now) because jobs is py2 and fail.

We need to set up the Tempest on system wide based on  INSTALL_TEMPEST flag
which is set to false on all stable branch to:
- https://review.opendev.org/#/q/I60949fb735c82959fb2cfcb6aeef9e33fb0445b6

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/398d906e73724ee6b91d8f32babc5035/log/logs/devstacklog.txt#37969
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717428/
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717529/

Change-Id: I13153881223c3a585052a94651b9ff082a75b283

commit_message:
Fix Tempest installtion on system wide for stable branch

INSTALL_TEMPEST flag enable to install Tempest by default on
devstack env which is meant for using on master gate only and has
to be false for stable branch. On stable branch master Tempest
on system wide can fail to install for various reason like constraint
etc. That is why we install Tempest on venv always.

This started failing the py2 jobs on stable/train gate[1] where
heat devstack plugin try to install Tempest on system wide also which try to
use py2 env (Tempest is py3 only now) because jobs is py2 and fail.

We need to set up the Tempest on system wide based on  INSTALL_TEMPEST flag
which is set to false on all stable branch to:
- https://review.opendev.org/#/q/I60949fb735c82959fb2cfcb6aeef9e33fb0445b6

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/398d906e73724ee6b91d8f32babc5035/log/logs/devstacklog.txt#37969
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717428/
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717529/

Change-Id: I13153881223c3a585052a94651b9ff082a75b283

commit_message:
Remove unit test jobs with latest puppet

We don't have unit tests with latest puppet in stable/stein, so it
doesn't make sense to have it in older branches.

Change-Id: I5860ad3e661aaef00629fded6065138a93965128

subject: Cleanup py27 support
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-04-13 10:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-04-13 10:46:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-04-13 11:03:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-04-13 11:23:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-04-13 11:41:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2020-04-13 14:10:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nThanks a lot for taking care of this!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-13 10:34:11.000000000', 'message': "Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine,
  move constraints into deps
- Move basepython into testenv

Change-Id: I96fe17a0a01b8bcca4dad16889def88305857d37
"}, {'created': '2020-04-13 10:46:33.000000000', 'message': "Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine,
  move constraints into deps

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Move basepython into testenv

Change-Id: I96fe17a0a01b8bcca4dad16889def88305857d37

commit_message:
WIP Create derived parameters playbook, modules, and role

The new `cli-derive-parameters.yaml` has been built to replace the mistral
workflow of the same name. This new playbook is leveraging several modules
which will take advantage of the new ansible module utilities for
tripleo-common. These modules will serve as a basis porting over the rest of
derived params. Existing modules that used a TripleOCommon class have been
updated to use the new module-utils as well. The role
`tripleo_derived_parameters` has been created, which will house all of the
required tasks to ensure an effective execution while also providing a
medium to test our process.

> Mock data has been added from a real deployment to ensure that the role
  data processing is correct and tested accordingly.

Change-Id: Ibbb599578e5a4fbed9b760c52a9594c6e95a56a6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

Add devstack plugin support

Instead of requiring users to install the plugin manually, add a
devstack plugin that can be enabled in order to perform the
installation.

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Switch to using sphinx-build
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Remove old python compatiblity test code

Change-Id: If7296703fc4848a16dd10d904ba3f49f19054546

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found.

Update local hacking checks for new flake8.

Remove local vi check, hacking test H106 covers this now.

Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, they are not needed
to be installed at run-time.

Change-Id: Id87f8b2d81583a7a67ee1a81c78d3ae40c579c70

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

We can now use the standard library mock library instead of the third
party one previously needed for py27 compatibility.

Change-Id: I51f48421ac90209302de43b70ef9176195be0743
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Introduce /etc/timezone to Debian/Ubuntu containers

Some services look for /etc/timezone on Debian/Ubuntu, so we should
introduce it to the containers.

In addition, added prechecks for /etc/localtime and /etc/timezone.

Closes-Bug: #1821592
Change-Id: I9fef14643d1bcc7eee9547eb87fa1fb436d8a6b3
(cherry picked from commit 4b5df0d8660543230a48d279f508c3205c8fc406)

commit_message:
Ported featureset060.yml to os_tempest.

Variables changed:
run_tempest: true -> run_tempest: false
tempest_workers -> tempest_run_concurrency
tempest_whitelist -> tempest_test_whitelist

New added variables:
use_os_tempest: true
tempest_services
tempest_tempestconf_profile_overrides

Change-Id: I8241c12ee3b7f84b713c12f5500447cb665ea370
Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support for docs

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Cleanup */source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version

Change-Id: I5f6aabc271e21fe8edbf2aadd2f78f8bdc407e80

checks need to be registered a different way to be discovered and run
during flake8 linting. This updates our local hacking checks to use the

commit_message:
Update local hacking checks

With the newer version of flake8, local extensions for our hacking
checks need to be registered a different way to be discovered and run
during flake8 linting. This updates our local hacking checks to use the
correct registration.

Change-Id: I2cf12449e0ce96fdd70eb6be223d4934002d40ad
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Switch to using sphinx-build
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine

Change-Id: I8582f554fa966d9e9b9e260918db84dcc02041b7

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-27 17:42:02.000000000', 'message': 'Set live_migration_inbound_addr for nova libvirt

The only way to influence which network is being used for live-migration
is to use live_migration_inbound_addr. Typically this is the IP address
that matches that in the libvirt connection url.

If you use a hostname, which is needed for tls, you need to make sure
that DNS is used to resolved the host, rather than relying on /etc/hosts
Note, if you have a stale /etc/hosts file inside a running QEMU process,
you must first restart the process before block migration is able to
complete. If live_migration_inbound_addr is an IP, then it also works.

Change-Id: I0201b46a9fbab21433a9f53685131aeb461543a8
'}, {'created': '2020-04-09 16:39:45.000000000', 'message': "Use IP address for Nova live migration

In kolla ansible we typically configure services to communicate via IP
addresses rather than hostnames. One exception to this is live
migration, which currently uses the hostname of the destination. To make
this work, we add entries to /etc/hosts in the bootstrap-servers
command. Alternatively users may provide DNS.

One problem with using /etc/hosts is that if a new compute host is added
to the cloud, or an IP address is changed, that will not be reflected in
the /etc/hosts file of other hosts. This will cause live migration to
the new host from an old host to fail, as the name cannot be resolved.

The workaround for this is to update the /etc/hosts file (perhaps via
bootstrap-servers) on all hosts after adding new compute hosts. The
nova_libvirt container must then be restarted to pick up the change.

The only way to influence which network is being used for live-migration
is to use live_migration_inbound_addr. Typically this is the IP address
that matches that in the libvirt connection url.

This change adds the live_migration_inbound_addr option to nova.conf. If
TLS is not in use for libvirt, this will be set to the IP address of the
host on the migration network. If TLS is enabled for libvirt,
live_migration_inbound_addr will be set to migration_hostname, since
certificates will typically reference the hostname rather than the
host's IP. With libvirt TLS enabled, DNS is recommended to avoid this
issue.

Change-Id: I0201b46a9fbab21433a9f53685131aeb461543a8
Closes-Bug: #1729566
"}, {'created': '2020-04-09 18:16:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix live migration to use migration int. address

In kolla ansible we typically configure services to communicate via IP
addresses rather than hostnames. One accidental exception to this was
live migration, which used the hostname of the destination even when
not required (i.e. TLS not being used for libvirt).

To make such hostnames work, k-a adds entries to /etc/hosts in the
bootstrap-servers command. Alternatively users may provide DNS.

One problem with using /etc/hosts is that, if a new compute host is
added to the cloud, or an IP address is changed, that will not be
reflected in the /etc/hosts file of other hosts. This would cause live
migration to the new host from an old host to fail, as the name cannot
be resolved.

The workaround for this was to update the /etc/hosts file (perhaps via
bootstrap-servers) on all hosts after adding new compute hosts. Then the
nova_libvirt container had to be restarted to pick up the change.

Similarly, if user has overridden the migration_interface, the used
hostname could point to a wrong address on which libvirt would not
listen.

This change adds the live_migration_inbound_addr option to nova.conf. If
TLS is not in use for libvirt, this will be set to the IP address of the
host on the migration network. If TLS is enabled for libvirt,
live_migration_inbound_addr will be set to migration_hostname, since
certificates will typically reference the hostname rather than the
host's IP. With libvirt TLS enabled, DNS is recommended to avoid the
/etc/hosts issue which is likely the case in production deployments.

Change-Id: I0201b46a9fbab21433a9f53685131aeb461543a8
Closes-Bug: #1729566
"}, {'created': '2020-04-09 18:17:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix live migration to use migration int. address

Similarly, if user has overridden the migration_interface, the used

Change-Id: I0201b46a9fbab21433a9f53685131aeb461543a8

commit_message:
Fix live migration to use migration int. address

In kolla ansible we typically configure services to communicate via IP
addresses rather than hostnames. One accidental exception to this was
live migration, which used the hostname of the destination even when
not required (i.e. TLS not being used for libvirt).

To make such hostnames work, k-a adds entries to /etc/hosts in the
bootstrap-servers command. Alternatively users may provide DNS.

One problem with using /etc/hosts is that, if a new compute host is
added to the cloud, or an IP address is changed, that will not be
reflected in the /etc/hosts file of other hosts. This would cause live
migration to the new host from an old host to fail, as the name cannot
be resolved.

The workaround for this was to update the /etc/hosts file (perhaps via
bootstrap-servers) on all hosts after adding new compute hosts. Then the
nova_libvirt container had to be restarted to pick up the change.

Similarly, if user has overridden the migration_interface, the used
hostname could point to a wrong address on which libvirt would not
listen.

This change adds the live_migration_inbound_addr option to nova.conf. If
TLS is not in use for libvirt, this will be set to the IP address of the
host on the migration network. If TLS is enabled for libvirt,
live_migration_inbound_addr will be set to migration_hostname, since
certificates will typically reference the hostname rather than the
host's IP. With libvirt TLS enabled, DNS is recommended to avoid the
/etc/hosts issue which is likely the case in production deployments.

Change-Id: I0201b46a9fbab21433a9f53685131aeb461543a8
Closes-Bug: #1729566

commit_message:
Remove MEMOIZE from get_pod_ip

get_pod_ip() does not make any API calls and just gets the IP from VIF
annotation. Maybe it would make some sense to cache it to avoid several
dict lookups, but current version bases cache on whole pod object, which
we know may change often over time, so I don't think there's a point in
keeping the cache here.

Change-Id: Id441700ac7add94a675c3a38434abae0b826b766

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie86a91c11969126ed34cfd96efc064e69a1319cf

[{'created': '2018-10-02 22:37:29.000000000', 'message': "Allow amp-list test to run in a busy environment

If the environment is busy, other amps may be moving around in transient
states, and could throw off this test (not to mention there could be a
LOT of them). Limit the number of amps we check, and ignore status
checks on the ones in obviously transient states.

There is still ONE possible issue here, which is if a READY amp is
assigned to a LB in the middle of the test, it's possible we'll catch it
at a bad time -- but, try to limit the window as much as possible.

Change-Id: Id7196f044015fcf03cbe2e41881b35b8dc217835
"}, {'created': '2019-06-20 21:36:00.000000000', 'message': "Allow amp-list test to run in a busy environment

commit_message:
Allow amp-list test to run in a busy environment

If the environment is busy, other amps may be moving around in transient
states, and could throw off this test (not to mention there could be a
LOT of them). Limit the number of amps we check, and ignore status
checks on the ones in obviously transient states.

There is still ONE possible issue here, which is if a READY amp is
assigned to a LB in the middle of the test, it's possible we'll catch it
at a bad time -- but, try to limit the window as much as possible.

Change-Id: Id7196f044015fcf03cbe2e41881b35b8dc217835

commit_message:
vif: Remove dead code

We have had support for handling 'bridge' type VIFs with os-vif, via the
'_nova_to_osvif_vif_bridge' helper, since the os-vif-library was first
introduced in change Id78858bc55ce4f3f0727cad644ef9c8f9f718556. This
means the legacy path is never executed, which has been proven in
practice since this path references function that don't actually exist
now ('nova.virt.libvirt.designer.set_vif_host_backend_bridge_config').
We should have spotted this when we removed the crazy getattr-based VIF
lookup mechanism in change Idf08adca1e3a0d19e20bca2447c83f7372516cb7,
but we didn't so do it now.

Change-Id: Iaf1584112566a14807562fc46f7a70e526bbcbf0
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add Python3 victoria unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for victoria.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I89f686de56a42792a9094a15701eaaaa46c1ea86
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-03-17 09:45:42.000000000', 'message': 'address specific resources cleanup issue

If an instance is in migrating, we store the new_resources and
old_resources in instance.migration_context.

To address the resource cleanup like vpmem during migration, we
modify the mutated_migration_context to temporarily apply/revert
the migration context, then we can use the temporary instance.resources
to do cleanup.

Change-Id: I91df821ef40ed2329d6510171e8b527d8c6f5542
'}]
commit_message:
address specific resources cleanup issue

If an instance is in migrating, we store the new_resources and
old_resources in instance.migration_context.

To address the resource cleanup like vpmem during migration, we
modify the mutated_migration_context to temporarily apply/revert
the migration context, then we can use the temporary instance.resources
to do cleanup.

Change-Id: I91df821ef40ed2329d6510171e8b527d8c6f5542

commit_message:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-31 12:29:21.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Respect multiple segments in network

Each network could have multiple segments defined, but
all segments within the network should be using the same
network type.
Provider networks, like vlan or flat, could have multiple segments
defined and different configuration of 'provider:physical_network',
that means different physical_network. We should follow those
differences.

In addition tunneled type networks (geneve, vxlan) could also have
multiple segments.

This patch modifies the behavior to respect multiple segments
for all types of networks.

Change-Id: Ibc939bcec7cf911ec33c159c4a8ecd6ac587a544
Related-Bug: 1869877

commit_message:
[WIP] Respect multiple segments in network

Each network could have multiple segments defined, but
all segments within the network should be using the same
network type.
Provider networks, like vlan or flat, could have multiple segments
defined and different configuration of 'provider:physical_network',
that means different physical_network. We should follow those
differences.

In addition tunneled type networks (geneve, vxlan) could also have
multiple segments.

This patch modifies the behavior to respect multiple segments
for all types of networks.

Change-Id: Ibc939bcec7cf911ec33c159c4a8ecd6ac587a544
Related-Bug: 1869877

commit_message:
[WIP] unbind port before evacuate and shelve offload

This attempts to prevent early network_vif_plugged events
by unbinding the ports before the instance is removed from
the host.

Change-Id: Iac63a68e935a23a2387f3c03db75058317159eae
Related-Bug: #1813789

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
  * Some other sections are obsolete
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore

Change-Id: I69f42c50f94d9511179185b6f0de37a8b8dd0469

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Support of Multiple Replication

Add support for multiple replication devices in the PowerMax
driver for Cinder to allow the use of multiple replication
modes concurrently.

Change-Id: I8fcd5bb0209ede5099a9f2f5c23b7da5b59a819a
Implements: blueprint powermax-multiple-replication-devices

commit_message:
Support different vGPU types per pGPU

It's now possible to have a different vGPU type for each pGPU. By modifying
the config, you can say which PCI device (ie. a pGPU) should use a specific
vGPU type.

For upgrades, the behaviour from Train won't be changed since we only use
the first type if we don't have the dynamic options (so operators don't
need to change nova.conf before upgrading).

Implements: blueprint vgpu-multiple-types

Change-Id: I46f0a76811142888db2bbc66cc3fde04ff890c01

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ibc89282042e52cc483c6624d8771d42e72707fbe

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I49cac417d3ff809a986394d020d0c9ce4c72d800

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Switch to using sphinx-build
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine

Change-Id: I3d5b3cf0bff4218fc39b3bb9d36e2cfa3bb222f5

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Switch to using sphinx-build
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Switch to openstackdocstheme version
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Fix docs warnings

Change-Id: Icf6a2d4229392e9d38af67567167b60d02d68019

commit_message:
Use kolla tools for memcached configuration

This change updates the memcached service to leverage the kolla
configuration to configure and launch the memcached service. This is the
same pattern we use for the other services.

Related-Bug: #1871734
Change-Id: Ib0bfc3e9009357f0aed28c0a10b927c5ca2e53a7
(cherry picked from commit 71e9b806b4765ebe5474c26621ef8ddcec3f5039)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-02 14:48:26.000000000', 'message': "Calculate over_committed_disk_size for raw instances

During update_available_resource periodic task, nova-compute reports total
amount of over_committed_disk_size in order to determine current hypervisor's
available_disk_least.

Currently, over_committed_disk_size is set to 0 for raw instances, which is
appropriate when preallocate_space option is enabled because file size is equal
to allocated size.
If not set, the raw disk file is thin and over_committed_disk_size have to be
calculated in order to not mislead available_disk_least value.

This change introduces over_committed_disk_size calucation also for raw disk.

Closes-Bug: #1870357

Change-Id: I9788ab12f5cfe0b1884f265482ceb9f533e9574e
"}, {'created': '2020-04-06 16:14:45.000000000', 'message': "Calculate disk_over_committed for raw instances

During update_available_resource periodic task, nova-compute reports total
amount of disk_over_committed in order to determine current hypervisor's
available_disk_least.

Currently, disk_over_committed is set to 0 for raw instances, which is
appropriate when preallocate_images option is enabled because file size
is equal to allocated size.
If not set, the raw disk file is thin and over_committed_disk_size have to be
calculated in order to not mislead available_disk_least value.

This change introduces over_committed_disk_size calucation also for raw disk.

In addition, because disk file can have allocated size greater than virtual
disk size, we consider returning 0 instead of a negative value, as a negative
value will inaccurately increase available_disk_least.

Closes-Bug: #1870357

Change-Id: I9788ab12f5cfe0b1884f265482ceb9f533e9574e
"}, {'created': '2020-04-09 12:14:55.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Calculate disk_over_committed for raw instances

During update_available_resource periodic task, nova-compute reports total
amount of disk_over_committed in order to determine current hypervisor's
available_disk_least.

Currently, disk_over_committed is set to 0 for raw instances, which is
appropriate when [compute]/preallocate_images option is set to space as images
are fully allocated and because file size is equal to allocated size.
If not set, the raw disk file is sparsely allocated and
over_committed_disk_size have to be calculated in order to not mislead
available_disk_least value.

This change introduces over_committed_disk_size calucation also for raw disk.

Closes-Bug: #1870357

Change-Id: I9788ab12f5cfe0b1884f265482ceb9f533e9574e
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Calculate disk_over_committed for raw instances

During update_available_resource periodic task, nova-compute reports total
amount of disk_over_committed in order to determine current hypervisor's
available_disk_least.

Currently, disk_over_committed is set to 0 for raw instances, which is
appropriate when [compute]/preallocate_images option is set to space as images
are fully allocated and because file size is equal to allocated size.
If not set, the raw disk file is sparsely allocated and
over_committed_disk_size have to be calculated in order to not mislead
available_disk_least value.

This change introduces over_committed_disk_size calucation also for raw disk.

Closes-Bug: #1870357

Change-Id: I9788ab12f5cfe0b1884f265482ceb9f533e9574e

Cap Pygments for python 2.7

The last Pygments release to support python 2 is 2.5.2, so our
python 2 tests are failing running the latest version 2.6.1.

CentOS7 by CentOS8 completely.

 Failed Plugins: x/glare, x/tap-as-a-service,
 + [[ -n x/glare, x/tap-as-a-service,  ]]

It looks the root cause is related to pg_config installation but not

commit_message:
Add glare and taas to blacklist

This commit adds x/glare and x/tap-as-a-service to the BLACKLIST to
avoid sanity-job failures like following.

 Failed Plugins: x/glare, x/tap-as-a-service,
 + [[ -n x/glare, x/tap-as-a-service,  ]]
 + exit 1

It looks the root cause is related to pg_config installation but not
sure. So, this commit just blacklists them as a workaround.

 Error: pg_config executable not found.

Change-Id: I03c6f01593b8e414b5e111d0e0c971ae156da715

microversion 2.74. This patch adds a clients kwarg to
create_test_server(). This kwarg is then passed to compute.common's
create_test_server() instead of the cls.os_primary clients that was

commit_message:
Pass clients to compute base's create_test_server

Previously, create_test_server() in the base compute test class did
not provide a way to create a server with admin privileges. This can
be necessary when using APIs that are admin-only by default, for
example the `host` parameter when creating a server in Nova
microversion 2.74. This patch adds a clients kwarg to
create_test_server(). This kwarg is then passed to compute.common's
create_test_server() instead of the cls.os_primary clients that was
harcoded previously.

Change-Id: Ic47e6a4ced54739de9325bb14e332ba15cdb210f

Change-Id: Ib3f928963b11a2041caf1c3b15825125567ce360
Story: #2007537
Task: #39356
'}]
commit_message:
Convert str to bytes for py3 socket compatibility

socket.sendto() requires bytes and we need explicitly convert str to
bytes in py3.

Change-Id: Ib3f928963b11a2041caf1c3b15825125567ce360
Story: #2007537
Task: #39356

[{'created': '2020-04-10 08:48:23.000000000', 'message': 'Increase VM RAM value in local.conf example

Based on recent changes that make dib image to be default in CI,
the base RAM in the local.conf example should be increased to

Change-Id: If8b0a3bbdce8cd1e6d564c9b7b9505729e4eec26

commit_message:
Increase VM RAM value in local.conf example

Based on recent changes that make dib image to be default in CI,
the base RAM in the local.conf example should be increased to
2048, which is the minimum recommended to run the centos8 ramdisk.

Change-Id: If8b0a3bbdce8cd1e6d564c9b7b9505729e4eec26

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support and docs

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Remove unneeded test-requirements.txt file
- Use basepython=python3 for testenv, remove it elsewhere

Change-Id: I2659000c905b3de2f37bd88ab348d2f45e0968cc

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
  * Some other sections are obsolete
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore

Change-Id: I93294c42a967ca19b9b04ead9cd636b52f1cc038

subject: Fix invalid escape sequence warning
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 8313, 'name': 'Lajos Katona', 'email': 'katonalala@gmail.com', 'username': 'elajkat'}, {'_account_id': 11975, 'name': 'Slawek Kaplonski', 'email': 'skaplons@redhat.com', 'username': 'slaweq'}, {'_account_id': 12860, 'name': 'Dongcan Ye', 'email': 'yedongcan@yeah.net', 'username': 'yedongcan'}, {'_account_id': 15905, 'name': 'Cao Xuan Hoang', 'email': 'xuanhoangqb@gmail.com', 'username': 'hoangcx'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 12860, 'date': '2020-04-08 13:12:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12860, 'date': '2020-04-08 14:29:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-04-09 08:27:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

As I see you covered all non-py3 strings'}, {'account_id': 12860, 'date': '2020-04-10 15:33:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> As I see you covered all non-py3 strings

Yeah, I think it's no harm."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2020-04-11 08:14:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15905, 'date': '2020-04-13 01:36:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-08 13:12:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix invalid escape sequence warning

Python 3 interprets string literals as Unicode strings,
and therefore '\d' is treated as an escaped Unicode character.

If you’re not using a raw string to express the pattern,
remember that Python also uses the backslash as an escape sequence in
string literals; if the escape sequence isn’t recognized by Python’s parser,
the backslash and subsequent character are included in the resulting string.
However, if Python would recognize the resulting sequence, the backslash
should be repeated twice. This is complicated and hard to understand,
so it’s highly recommended that you use raw strings for all but the
simplest expressions. [1]

This patch use raw string for the regular expression.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3.6/library/re.html#regular-expression-syntax

Change-Id: Ibee059af3b24896749b66d87a6691fdf40a5767a
Closes-Bug: #1871621
"}]
commit_message:
Fix invalid escape sequence warning

Python 3 interprets string literals as Unicode strings,
and therefore '\d' is treated as an escaped Unicode character.

If you’re not using a raw string to express the pattern,
remember that Python also uses the backslash as an escape sequence in
string literals; if the escape sequence isn’t recognized by Python’s parser,
the backslash and subsequent character are included in the resulting string.
However, if Python would recognize the resulting sequence, the backslash
should be repeated twice. This is complicated and hard to understand,
so it’s highly recommended that you use raw strings for all but the
simplest expressions. [1]

This patch use raw string for the regular expression.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3.6/library/re.html#regular-expression-syntax

Change-Id: Ibee059af3b24896749b66d87a6691fdf40a5767a
Closes-Bug: #1871621

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I4e921bbbcc7f73a85a19622e0305918c9b068016

commit_message:
Temporarily skip TestNovaMigrationsMySQL

We are hitting bug 1823251 more frequently again close to the Ussuri
Feature Freeze. So let's temporary turn of the unstable patches. We
don't have patches in the queue with DB model changes so loosing this
coverage is not super critical.

Change-Id: I51039c4c5817add873a289234ab79569d2520cb3
Related-Bug: #1823251

[{'created': '2020-02-19 05:54:12.000000000', 'message': "API: os-reset_status notification fix

This patch fixes the os-reset_status api call notifications for
volumes, snapshots and backups and deprecates the existing
notifications scheme for os-reset_status.

Existing notifications for
volumes are going to a publisher_id of 'volumeStatusUpdate'.
Notifications for snapshots were going to 'volumeStatusUpdate'.
Notifications for backups were going to 'backupStatusUpdate'.

This patch changes notifications for volumes to go to the 'volume'
publisher_id as all other volume actions in cinder.
This patch changes notifications for snapshots to go to the 'snapshot'
publisher_id as all other snapshot actions in cinder.
This patch changes notifications for backups to go to the 'backup'
publisher_id as all other backups actions in cinder.

Change-Id: I2550b00127ee2533b0ab12c4efb4927dbcaaa190
Closes-Bug: 1863806

commit_message:
API: os-reset_status notification fix

This patch fixes the os-reset_status api call notifications for
volumes, snapshots and backups and deprecates the existing
notifications scheme for os-reset_status.

Existing notifications for
volumes are going to a publisher_id of 'volumeStatusUpdate'.
Notifications for snapshots were going to 'volumeStatusUpdate'.
Notifications for backups were going to 'backupStatusUpdate'.

This patch changes notifications for volumes to go to the 'volume'
publisher_id as all other volume actions in cinder.
This patch changes notifications for snapshots to go to the 'snapshot'
publisher_id as all other snapshot actions in cinder.
This patch changes notifications for backups to go to the 'backup'
publisher_id as all other backups actions in cinder.

Change-Id: I2550b00127ee2533b0ab12c4efb4927dbcaaa190
Closes-Bug: 1863806

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in server metadata

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for server metadata API policies
as 'system' and 'project'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I669fc0d64fd261d5e91fbea5556255f03a0801ee

(1 comment)

This is a bit of a weird one. On one hand, it's new functionality that didn't previously exist and the microversion makes that discoverable. On the other hand, it's not totally discoverable because you require support from the host, meaning it could fail still, and the allowable API responses haven't changed (then as now, the operation would pass if you met all the constraints and fail otherwise, and we've just tweaked the constraints). Is this definitely a microversionable thing?"}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-02-19 15:31:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > This is a bit of a weird one. On one hand, it's new functionality
 > that didn't previously exist and the microversion makes that
 > discoverable. On the other hand, it's not totally discoverable
 > because you require support from the host, meaning it could fail
 > still, and the allowable API responses haven't changed (then as
 > now, the operation would pass if you met all the constraints and
 > fail otherwise, and we've just tweaked the constraints). Is this
 > definitely a microversionable thing?

I seriously hope so after putting a load of time and effort into this! :)

I think it is on the basis of new functionality being introduced *and* the meaning of a 400 return from a BFV instance request now being that the selected host is incapable of completing the request.

There's more back and fourth about this in the spec review FWIW I1a7b6386a42a4520c298c18394636053ce28b1d8, there might be better justification buried in there that I'm forgetting. ./me opens and reviews again."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-02-26 10:16:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2020-02-26 10:45:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
api: Introduce microverion 2.87 allowing boot from volume rescue

Building on Ic2ad1468d31b7707b7f8f2b845a9cf47d9d076d5, when requested
this microversion will allow boot from volume requests to proceed when
the COMPUTE_RESCUE_BFV trait is also reported by the compute the
instance currently resides on.

Implements: blueprint virt-bfv-instance-rescue
Change-Id: I3242fec1547693078cf36c3637116f8c41f1d0bc

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-12 15:55:33.000000000', 'message': "Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine,
  update constraints to current URL

Change-Id: I45fc7e79bc7abf266721d819f4f857d06a701724

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine,
  update constraints to current URL

Change-Id: I45fc7e79bc7abf266721d819f4f857d06a701724

[{'created': '2020-03-18 15:49:48.000000000', 'message': "SAN: Add missing driver options

Drivers can now report the configuration options that are relevant for
them with the `get_driver_options` method, but most of them are just
reporting their unique options and not the ones they share with other
drivers (ie: `san_ip`, `san_login`, `san_password`).

This patch adds additional options to SanDriver drivers so they return a
more meaningful list of options.

To help with this it adds a helper method called `_get_oslo_driver_opts`
which can return a list of oslo options from names.

This includes very common options such as `max_over_subscription_ratio`,
`reserved_percentage`, and `replication_device`, but doesn't include the
`volume_backend_name` configuration option, since that's common to ALL
Cinder drivers.

Change-Id: I0ba2bbf1b707f93081cad8fabcc8dafb7b7d67d2
"}, {'created': '2020-03-25 12:56:14.000000000', 'message': "SAN: Add missing driver options

commit_message:
SAN: Add missing driver options

Drivers can now report the configuration options that are relevant for
them with the `get_driver_options` method, but most of them are just
reporting their unique options and not the ones they share with other
drivers (ie: `san_ip`, `san_login`, `san_password`).

This patch adds additional options to SanDriver drivers so they return a
more meaningful list of options.

To help with this it adds a helper method called `_get_oslo_driver_opts`
which can return a list of oslo options from names.

This includes very common options such as `max_over_subscription_ratio`,
`reserved_percentage`, and `replication_device`, but doesn't include the
`volume_backend_name` configuration option, since that's common to ALL
Cinder drivers.

Change-Id: I0ba2bbf1b707f93081cad8fabcc8dafb7b7d67d2

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-25 12:57:25.000000000', 'message': 'Remove suds from requirements

The suds-jurko requirement was needed by the Disco and Datacore drivers,
but of which have since been removed. This cleans up the requirements to
remove that library.

Change-Id: I141c2c141aeea84272d2b04610e53822bc3b3371
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove suds from requirements

The suds-jurko requirement was needed by the Disco and Datacore drivers,
but of which have since been removed. This cleans up the requirements to
remove that library.

Change-Id: I141c2c141aeea84272d2b04610e53822bc3b3371
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Prepare upper-constraints for Victoria

With https://review.opendev.org/#/c/719031/ merged, repos will now
get voting py38 jobs. Currently, upper-constraints does not contain any
py38 entries, add them where needed.

The change was generated by the following sed script:

sed -i -e "s|^\(.*\);python_version=='3.7'|&\n\1;python_version=='3.8'|g" upper-constraints.txt

Change-Id: Ib513d7262f35234f26096f88a92dbb8c1fa8f0ef

Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I36c82d529f649f5943d25cb528886642f9d051fd

commit_message:
mariadb: add pynacl dependency to support ed25519

In order to support configuration of ed25519 authentication,
puppet-tripleo uses a python helper that depends on pynacl.

Update the kolla config override to install pynacl in the mariadb
image to support the ed25519 use case.

Change-Id: I908b2af6acce25dfb115463f9d04b0e14c7cba33
Related-Bug: #1866093

Thanks for your analysis in the bug report and for the clear commit message.  Code LGTM.

BTW, I guess we don't have a scenario test for this in the cinder-tempest-plugin or we would have detected the problem earlier.  It would be good to add one, because I wonder how many other drivers may have this same issue.  (Just thinking out loud here, though of course if you'd be interested in adding a scenario test, that would be awesome!)"}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2020-03-27 00:01:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Thanks for your analysis in the bug report and for the clear commit
 > message.  Code LGTM.
 > 
 > BTW, I guess we don't have a scenario test for this in the
 > cinder-tempest-plugin or we would have detected the problem
 > earlier.  It would be good to add one, because I wonder how many
 > other drivers may have this same issue.  (Just thinking out loud
 > here, though of course if you'd be interested in adding a scenario

commit_message:
Do not rename rbd based volume after migration

After rbd based volume migrated (retyped), it will be
renamed to the original name unless name collision or
some errors happen. But the problem is this information
seems not reflect on connection info, especially this volume
is already in-use.

This patch mimics behavior of lvm driver by not renaming
in-used volume after migration(retype)

Close-Bug: #1866935

Change-Id: I4db0dc978d55d4704dd60e2eb8738b38ddefbbbd

commit_message:
functional: Fix stable functional imports of Placement

Placement is installed directly from master within the functional tests
however since py27 support was dropped by
0f90d197e11d7aa605c0e1d338db1d146a00d8eb this will now fail. This stable
only change pins Placement to the same stable branch as Nova.

Change-Id: I6502a9193a65c76d07bc840895fe77a325be26b3

commit_message:
functional: Fix stable functional imports of Placement

Placement is installed directly from master within the functional tests
however since py27 support was dropped by
0f90d197e11d7aa605c0e1d338db1d146a00d8eb this will now fail. This stable
only change pins Placement to the same stable branch as Nova.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflicts due to the change in branch and
I3e0af55e0707f04428a422b973d016ad30c82a12 also not being present in
stable/stein.

Conflicts:
    tox.ini

Change-Id: I6502a9193a65c76d07bc840895fe77a325be26b3
(cherry picked from commit 1bb52279fe79d548bf6a2ed5c344c4d382483ecc)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-10 12:36:39.000000000', 'message': '[check-approval] Use committer instead of owner

The check-release-approval job currently considers a change being
approved if a release liaison is the change owner, or if a release
liaison approves it in a subsequent vote.

This means that if a release liaison pushes the original change (and
is therefore the change owner), any patchset pushed above the original
one will retain the owner and therefore the approval.

Instead of the change owner, use the committer of the last revision.

Change-Id: I2f7730626a8785b63f88fdf5d507fbd97717b8f3
'}]
commit_message:
[check-approval] Use committer instead of owner

The check-release-approval job currently considers a change being
approved if a release liaison is the change owner, or if a release
liaison approves it in a subsequent vote.

This means that if a release liaison pushes the original change (and
is therefore the change owner), any patchset pushed above the original
one will retain the owner and therefore the approval.

Instead of the change owner, use the committer of the last revision.

Change-Id: I2f7730626a8785b63f88fdf5d507fbd97717b8f3

commit_message:
Make job template update best effort

Some instances have failed due to the repo not being configured for the
expected series job templates. This changes the modified file detection
to only look for the zuul files we care about, then not error out on git
operations if it ends up we can't actually commit and propose changes.

Change-Id: Ic301b039d080dfc0bcbefeecce099c8fd00ad8c5
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Fix HAProxy prechecks during scale-out with limit
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-02 10:21:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-02 10:33:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-09 15:12:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2020-04-12 15:25:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-02 10:21:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix HAProxy prechecks during scale-out with limit

Deploy HAProxy on one or more servers. Add another server to the
inventory in the haproxy group, and run the following:

kolla-ansible prechecks --limit <new host>

The following task will fail:

    TASK [haproxy : Checking if kolla_internal_vip_address and
    kolla_external_vip_address are not pingable from any node]

This happens because ansible does not execute on hosts where
haproxy/keepalived is running, and therefore does not know that the VIP
should be active.

This change skips VIP prechecks when not all HAProxy hosts are in the
play.

Closes-Bug: #1868986

Change-Id: Ifbc73806b768f76f803ab01c115a9e5c2e2492ac
(cherry picked from commit f3350d4e130b17b4035a8b67420d7015fc6cc99b)
(cherry picked from commit 79747c4d8dfcad54a120d3f587501e8e7300d5b7)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix HAProxy prechecks during scale-out with limit

Deploy HAProxy on one or more servers. Add another server to the
inventory in the haproxy group, and run the following:

kolla-ansible prechecks --limit <new host>

The following task will fail:

    TASK [haproxy : Checking if kolla_internal_vip_address and
    kolla_external_vip_address are not pingable from any node]

This happens because ansible does not execute on hosts where
haproxy/keepalived is running, and therefore does not know that the VIP
should be active.

This change skips VIP prechecks when not all HAProxy hosts are in the
play.

Closes-Bug: #1868986

Change-Id: Ifbc73806b768f76f803ab01c115a9e5c2e2492ac
(cherry picked from commit f3350d4e130b17b4035a8b67420d7015fc6cc99b)
(cherry picked from commit 79747c4d8dfcad54a120d3f587501e8e7300d5b7)

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version, update other requirements

Change-Id: I2aec09250c96bc411d19cb6c1a1ee852394d39e5

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-10 10:51:35.000000000', 'message': "support live migration with vpmems

Introduce 'dst_resources' field into LibvirtLiveMigrateData object
to store ordered resources claimed on the destination host, which
will be used to update the new xml on the source host.

We only have LibvirtVPMEMDevice as metadata field in Resource object
currently, other driver-specific resources can be supported easily in
the future.

Change-Id: I5c346e690148678a2f0dc63f4f516a944c3db8cd
Partially-Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory
"}, {'created': '2019-10-11 06:20:31.000000000', 'message': "support live migration with vpmems

Introduce 'dst_resources' field into LibvirtLiveMigrateData object
to store ordered resources claimed on the destination host, which
will be used to update the new xml on the source host.

We only have LibvirtVPMEMDevice as metadata field in Resource object
currently, other driver-specific resources can be supported easily in
the future.

Change-Id: I5c346e690148678a2f0dc63f4f516a944c3db8cd
Partially-Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory
"}, {'created': '2019-11-12 07:47:31.000000000', 'message': "support live migration with vpmems

Introduce 'dst_resources' field into LibvirtLiveMigrateData object
to store ordered resources claimed on the destination host, which
will be used to update the new xml on the source host.

We only have LibvirtVPMEMDevice as metadata field in Resource object
currently, other driver-specific resources can be supported easily in
the future.

Change-Id: I5c346e690148678a2f0dc63f4f516a944c3db8cd
Partially-Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory
"}, {'created': '2019-12-04 07:56:28.000000000', 'message': 'support live migration with vpmems

1. Get allocations from placement
2. Claim specific resources (e.g. vpmem) in Resource Tracker according
   to allocations, stored in instance.migration_context.new_resources
3. instance.migration_context.new_resources will contain vpmem info claimed
   on destination host, it will be sorted during post_claim_migrate_data
4. On the source host, we generate new dest xml with vpmem info using
   instance.migration_context.new_resource, which is target xml used for
   live migration

Change-Id: I5c346e690148678a2f0dc63f4f516a944c3db8cd
Implements: blueprint support-live-migration-with-virtual-persistent-memory
'}, {'created': '2019-12-16 08:17:40.000000000', 'message': 'support live migration with vpmems

   on destination host, it will be sorted during post_claim_migrate_data
4. On the source host, we generate new dest xml with vpmem info using
   instance.migration_context.new_resource, which is target xml used for

'}, {'created': '2019-12-25 09:10:11.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] support live migration with vpmems

1. Get allocations from placement
2. Claim specific resources (e.g. vpmem) in Resource Tracker according
   to allocations, stored in instance.migration_context.new_resources
3. instance.migration_context.new_resources will contain vpmem info claimed
   on destination host, it will be sorted during post_claim_migrate_data
4. On the source host, we generate new dest xml with vpmem info using

'}, {'created': '2020-03-23 06:30:40.000000000', 'message': "support live migration with vpmems

1. Get allocations from placement
2. Claim specific resources (e.g. vpmem) in Resource Tracker according
   to allocations, stored in instance.migration_context.new_resources
3. instance.migration_context.new_resources will contain vpmem info claimed
   on destination host, it will be sorted during post_claim_migrate_data
4. On the source host, we generate new dest xml with vpmem info using
   instance.migration_context.new_resource, which is target xml used for
   live migration
5. cleanup vpmems on src/dest when live migration succeeds/fails

In _post_live_migration, even if post_live_migration_at_destination rpc call
fails, it will not break the cleanup procedure on source host. Since the
VM is already on dest host when we in _post_live_migration, we won't bring it
back to source host for anything wrong happening on dest host cleanup. Besides,
driver.cleanup shouldn't care aboout where it is called, it should be allowed to
be invoked everywhere. So we move driver.cleanup on source host before rpc call
post_live_migration_at_destination, the migration_context has not been applied
yet at that time, we can cleanup vpmem based on instance obj.

Change-Id: I5c346e690148678a2f0dc63f4f516a944c3db8cd
Implements: blueprint support-live-migration-with-virtual-persistent-memory

commit_message:
Support live migration with vpmem

1. Check if the cluster supports live migration with vpmem
2. On source host we generate new dest xml with vpmem info stored in
   migration_context.new_resources.
3. If there are vpmems, cleanup them on host/destination when live
   migration succeeds/fails

Change-Id: I5c346e690148678a2f0dc63f4f516a944c3db8cd
Implements: blueprint support-live-migration-with-virtual-persistent-memory

commit_message:
Separate update and swap volume policies

This patch changes the volume update policy to be
'rule:system_admin_or_owner' to allow instance owners to update
attachment details like delete_on_termination. It creates a new
volume swap policy element with the old admin-only behavior, and
makes the volume update code check the appropriate policy based
on what action is being performed.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>

Partial implement blueprint destroy-instance-with-datavolume
Change-Id: I2cbe37b65ceac2efb3b252460dc01d17474e6343

commit_message:
Drop concept of '?validation' parameter

We had planned to introduce a 'validation' parameter to the various
extra spec APIs in change If67f0d924ea372746a6dc440ea7bdc655e4f0bea to
configure a policy for extra spec validation. Following reviews, we've
decided to instead go with a strict policy for all known namespaces and
no validation for any unknown namespaces. Update the tests we had in
place for this.

Part of blueprint flavor-extra-spec-validators

Change-Id: If30990ec1c43177b7d13bd8ee1c5dc481265e47b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2020-04-08 10:54:06.000000000', 'message': 'Convert delete_on_termination from string to boolean

In volume update API we can update the 'delete_on_termination' since
microversion 2.85. The schema enforced "'delete_on_termination':
parameter_types.boolean" that field value is a boolean like string,
but we donot covert from string to boolean before update the
attachment's bdm, see [1].

[1]http://paste.openstack.org/show/791792/

This commit fix this issue, convert 'delete_on_termination' from string
to boolean before updating the bdm.

commit_message:
Convert delete_on_termination from string to boolean

In volume update API we can update the 'delete_on_termination' since
microversion 2.85. The schema enforced "'delete_on_termination':
parameter_types.boolean" that field value is a boolean like string,
but we donot covert from string to boolean before update the
attachment's bdm, see [1] (it is also commented in bug 1871598.).

[1]http://paste.openstack.org/show/791792/

This commit fix this issue, convert 'delete_on_termination' from string
to boolean before updating the bdm.

Closes-Bug: #1871598

Change-Id: Ied75efd46336917150f80be2db10f674575826ba

commit_message:
Allow operators to use "ceilometer-upgrade" parameters

Allow operators to use custom parameters with the ceilometer-upgrade
command. This is quite useful when using the dynamic pollster subsystem;
that sub-system provides flexibility to create and edit pollsters configs,
which affects gnocchi resource-type configurations. However, Ceilometer
uses default and hard-coded resource-type configurations; if one customizes
some of its default resource-types, he/she can get into trouble during
upgrades. Therefore, the only way to work around it is to use the
"--skip-gnocchi-resource-types" flag. This PR introduces a method for
operators to execute such customization, and many others if needed.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/718190/
Change-Id: I92f0edba92c9e3707d89b3ff4033ac886b29cf6d

commit_message:
Allow operators to use "ceilometer-upgrade" parameters

Allow operators to use custom parameters with the ceilometer-upgrade
command. This is quite useful when using the dynamic pollster subsystem;
that sub-system provides flexibility to create and edit pollsters configs,
which affects gnocchi resource-type configurations. However, Ceilometer
uses default and hard-coded resource-type configurations; if one customizes
some of its default resource-types, he/she can get into trouble during
upgrades. Therefore, the only way to work around it is to use the
"--skip-gnocchi-resource-types" flag. This PR introduces a method for
operators to execute such customization, and many others if needed.

Change-Id: Ice42d936476635b627b21dc8676fb7bc560cd3a9

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia2d300f1b14ade320ffd7c1f87fd4b9a1d3ba2c5

subject: [CI] Stop gating with manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm
messages: [{'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-04-11 11:11:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2020-04-11 18:05:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-11 11:11:02.000000000', 'message': '[CI] Stop gating with manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm

The job manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm is functionally
identical to manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm-ipv6-only.
Semantically, the only difference being that the service
host, and in turn the endpoint base for manila, and the
communication address for rabbitmq, mysql and other infra
services.

manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm-ipv6-only
has MANILA_SERVICE_HOST set to an IPv6 address,
for example:
MANILA_SERVICE_HOST='[::1]'
MANILA_ENDPOINT_BASE='http://[::1]:8786'

manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm has MANILA_SERVICE_HOST
set to an IPv4 address, for example:
MANILA_SERVICE_HOST='23.253.236.222'
MANILA_ENDPOINT_BASE='http://23.253.236.222:8786'

So lets drop the job enforcing IPv4 service host since
we have coverage for that scenario in other jobs that
we're running, including the voting
manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-dummy job.

I'd like to backport this change to stable/train
during which this job was duplicated to cover the scenario
of doing "ipv6-only" service host testing [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682716/

Change-Id: I51dc25889c1d1fb361f0be6f8c0aa47ca64c9aaa
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 14d081acf6d7eb3f54168070652510625f35bf09)
'}]
commit_message:
[CI] Stop gating with manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm

The job manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm is functionally
identical to manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm-ipv6-only.
Semantically, the only difference being that the service
host, and in turn the endpoint base for manila, and the
communication address for rabbitmq, mysql and other infra
services.

manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm-ipv6-only
has MANILA_SERVICE_HOST set to an IPv6 address,
for example:
MANILA_SERVICE_HOST='[::1]'
MANILA_ENDPOINT_BASE='http://[::1]:8786'

manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm has MANILA_SERVICE_HOST
set to an IPv4 address, for example:
MANILA_SERVICE_HOST='23.253.236.222'
MANILA_ENDPOINT_BASE='http://23.253.236.222:8786'

So lets drop the job enforcing IPv4 service host since
we have coverage for that scenario in other jobs that
we're running, including the voting
manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-dummy job.

I'd like to backport this change to stable/train
during which this job was duplicated to cover the scenario
of doing "ipv6-only" service host testing [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682716/

Change-Id: I51dc25889c1d1fb361f0be6f8c0aa47ca64c9aaa
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 14d081acf6d7eb3f54168070652510625f35bf09)

commit_message:
Add vitrage-persistor image

Kolla was missing vitrage-persistor image required by Vitrage
for data storage.

Change-Id: Id5e143636f9a81e7294b775f3d8b9134bee58054
Closes-Bug: #1869319

commit_message:
Cinder project: EOL driverfixes branches

As discussed on the mailing list [0,1], the following cinder branches
are tagged EOL at their current HEAD:
- driverfixes/mitaka
- driverfixes/newton

The Cinder team requests that the release team delete the branches
after the EOL tags are created.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-November/011136.html
[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-December/011378.html

Change-Id: Id5009782aec88819e0dc376d98e4bfdc6ad0a8be

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iabd0e42347cc54c8ffd019d8be0ef2a4f805c942

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8dcad8d604d7af3424b47a3e3e0438c66987b6e6

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support and docs

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Cleanup */source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Enable warnings for doc builds, fix doc build problems

Change-Id: Id1ecc85694dddd177dde628a031b7cb637932fbc

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-05 21:13:38.000000000', 'message': "[NetApp] Fix share replica failing for 'transfer in progress' error

This patch fix an issue in NetApp driver share replica periodic
check that erroneuouly set a share replica to error after receiving
a 'Another transfer is in progress' error. The driver now skips the
resync operation for all expected transfer in progress relationship
status.

Closes-Bug: #1848889
Change-Id: If82aaa184db84660389f82654279f3c5b238fd51
"}]
commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix share replica failing for 'transfer in progress' error

This patch fix an issue in NetApp driver share replica periodic
check that erroneuouly set a share replica to error after receiving
a 'Another transfer is in progress' error. The driver now skips the
resync operation for all expected transfer in progress relationship
status.

Closes-Bug: #1848889
Change-Id: If82aaa184db84660389f82654279f3c5b238fd51

commit_message:
Release final python-freezerclient for ussuri

Final ussuri client lib release for the April 9 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: I030327ae9546d50d975a786ed34c8f07983669e4
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-05 08:38:11.000000000', 'message': 'Add new default roles in shelve server policies

This adds new defaults roles in shelve server API policies.
This policy is default to
- PROJECT_MEMBER_OR_SYSTEM_ADMIN for shelve/unshelve
- SYSTEM_ADMIN for shelve offload.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I63e65789e8cc48b75c9e6e4e333624172fd298d8

commit_message:
Add new default roles in shelve server policies

This adds new defaults roles in shelve server API policies.
This policy is default to
- PROJECT_MEMBER_OR_SYSTEM_ADMIN for shelve/unshelve
- SYSTEM_ADMIN for shelve offload.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I63e65789e8cc48b75c9e6e4e333624172fd298d8

commit_message:
downgrade when host does not support capabilities

the function _get_guest_baseline_cpu_features will be called
inside update_provider_tree and if libvirt.VIR_ERR_NO_SUPPORT
is reported, the info log will be reported. considering
update_provider_tree is a periodic task, the logs are annoyin,
so downgrade this to debug level to avoid it

Change-Id: Ibfc88fb15bb96a54c966116ce2507ef84cc3087f

commit_message:
Ensure netlink.nla_slot tuple key is a string

Ensure Pyroute2 netlink.nla_slot first element ("name"), is properly
converted to a string value. E.g.:
  In:  (b'IFA_ADDRESS', '192.168.30.20')
  Out: ('IFA_ADDRESS', '192.168.30.20')

Conflicts:
      neutron/privileged/agent/linux/ip_lib.py

Change-Id: I87efe6cf8734bae6523106944e99fbd7db9ef4d5
Related-Bug: #1846360
(cherry picked from commit 43e150e690538a509be8177353269787790ee143)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I0ef054d7c3d47d4a86dc2a67f2ef0f584cb96ddf
Sem-Ver: feature

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-05 06:33:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add test coverage of existing shelve policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing shelve policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I4cab282ee95a39e0201a439f8cc18caa06547cd7

commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing shelve policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing shelve policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I4cab282ee95a39e0201a439f8cc18caa06547cd7

commit_message:
Pass the actual target in limits policy

Currently if target is not passed in context.can(),
it use defauls target which is context.user_id, context.project_id.
These defaults target are not useful as it pass the
context's user_id and project_id only which means we tell
oslo policy to verify the context data with context data.

This commit pass the actual target for limits policies
which is project_id because user_id passed is context.user_id
only.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I83523a29d212460b6e4536e7eb0992726c07bd81

commit_message:
Functional test with pGPUs

We provide two testclasses :
- one will only focus about a single supported type
- the other one will focus on multiple types

The idea is that we check that inventories are created at compute
startup accordingly with no allocations and then we verify when we boot
a server that both allocations are correctly made against the right
pGPU Resource Provider but also that the mdev is created.

Change-Id: Ib5dbcee295d8a78b9a55806054de6265c3663343

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.
2. Update some URLs to latest

Change-Id: Idd0f99aecbb80e7ed0af538a48ad22ebec855438

'}, {'created': '2020-03-25 15:39:23.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Support boot from volume stable device instance rescue

This change introduces support for boot from volume stable device
instance rescue to the Libvirt driver by building on
Ic2ad1468d31b7707b7f8f2b845a9cf47d9d076d5 and reporting the
supports_bfv_rescue capability and inturn the COMPUTE_RESCUE_BFV trait.

No additional logic is required to build the disk mapping in this
instance as I0e1241ae691afd2af12ef15706c454c05d9f932c had already
introduced this with support rescuing instances with volumes attached.

A unit test has however been introduced to assert the disk layout when
rescuing boot from volume instances, in-line with the existing tests.

The only change to the rescue method within the Libvirt driver is the
introduction of a call to utils.get_bdm_image_metadata when we fail to
lookup the image metadata of an instance. This function allowing us to
extract image metadata if any is present from the provided
block_device_mapping.

commit_message:
libvirt: Support boot from volume stable device instance rescue

This change introduces support for boot from volume stable device
instance rescue to the Libvirt driver by reporting the
supports_bfv_rescue capability.

The only change to the rescue method within the Libvirt driver is the
introduction of a call to utils.get_bdm_image_metadata when we fail to
lookup the image metadata of an instance. This function allowing us to
extract image metadata if any is present from the provided
block_device_mapping.

Implements: blueprint virt-bfv-instance-rescue

commit_message:
Handle new is_volume_backend join column query

If 'is_volume_backend' column is passed in getting instance list,
it will check if the instance is booted from volume or not and
accordingly is_volume_backend attribute will be set in the
DB Instance model which will later be used to set
is_volume_backend attribute in the Instance versioned object.

Partial-Bug: #1715570
Change-Id: I4fd75a70f096fe29489b12f60a2a913b783d1d1c

This patch does not include the following cases.
The 'updated_at' field is not updated in them.

* nova aggregate-add-host
* nova aggregate-remove-host

Are they out of scope in this patch?

It is better to create a common method to update the 'updated_at' field of the aggregate in the 'aggregates' table
and add calling the common method in the following methods of the Aggregate class.

* add_host
* delete_host
* update_metadata

The 'updated_at' field of the aggregate *object* should also be updated."}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-07-19 08:40:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-07-19 09:26:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> This patch does not include the following cases.
 > The 'updated_at' field is not updated in them.
 > 
 > * nova aggregate-add-host
 > * nova aggregate-remove-host
 > 
 > Are they out of scope in this patch?
 > 
 > It is better to create a common method to update the 'updated_at'
 > field of the aggregate in the 'aggregates' table
 > and add calling the common method in the following methods of the
 > Aggregate class.
 > 
 > * add_host
 > * delete_host
 > * update_metadata
 > 
 > The 'updated_at' field of the aggregate *object* should also be
 > updated.

Hi Takashi. Thanks for the comments. I have updated the patch for add-host as well as delete-host. The 'updated_at' field will be updated for host add and remove as well. Kindly check."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-07-19 10:37:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/580271/2/ : SUCCESS in 4h 42m 21s'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-07-30 12:27:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

There are some items to fix.

1. Inconsistency in creating an aggregate

When creating an aggregate with name only (without availability zone), the 'updated_at' is not set in the 'aggregates' database table and it is 'null' in the response.
When creating an aggregate with availability zone, the 'updated_at' is set in the 'aggregates' database table and The timestamp is included in the response.

2. 'updated_at' is 'null' or previous timestamp in adding host and removing host in the response

And IMO, it had better to add functional tests (regression tests) to ensure updating the timestamp in the database table and returning it in the response."}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-07-31 11:12:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-07-31 12:04:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

 >

 > table and it is 'null' in the response.
 > When creating an aggregate with availability zone, the 'updated_at'
 > is set in the 'aggregates' database table and The timestamp is
 > included in the response.
 Done

 > 2. 'updated_at' is 'null' or previous timestamp in adding host and
 > removing host in the response
 Done
