commit_message:
Preserve existing placement password during extraction

nova-placement previously used NovaPassword. When it was split out into
the standalone placement service a new password param was added.

This patch ensures that when the extraction occurs, PlacementPassword
defaults to the existing NovaPassword value so that we do not have to
update the placement password in keystone.
Works around the fact that the upgrade playbook currently does not run
the required tasks to update keystone resources.

Closes-bug: #1870528
Change-Id: I9c84a48f56ac372ad612e2cf68533e256117eff1
(cherry picked from commit 2698da0ccbc59a0e8ab95fd36a391c554d6d057d)

commit_message:
Move ceph-rgw and config overrides variables

If no CephRgw service is present there's no reason to have all the
rgw related variables generated.
This change moves the rgw variables to ceph-rgw.yml which will be
added when the service is deployed.

Closes-Bug: #1867006
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/711942
Change-Id: I6302cbd971ee0f82b21630f3a0f56a9ca9a18658

commit_message:
Add tripleo_role_networks to inventory role group vars

Both invertory host vars and deployment global vars set enabled_networks.
Host var is snake_case network, global var is CamelCase network.
Global var takes precedence as we explicly include it in the deployment
playbook.

Create tripleo_role_networks to avoid conflicts and drop the enabled_networks
host vars at it is not currently used (AFAICT).

Change-Id: I6108aebf49a4bbc98394987f56dce6bcbe521b3a
Related-bug: #1861296
(cherry picked from commit ff3e716b1a081e139943f2dedf0aec1df22e4f37)

commit_message:
Pass the actual target in os-console-auth-tokens policy

Currently if target is not passed in context.can(),
it use defauls target which is context.user_id, context.project_id.
These defaults target are not useful as it pass the
context's user_id and project_id only which means we tell
oslo policy to verify the context data with context data.

This commit pass the actual target for os-console-auth-tokens policies
which is empty dict because policy rule is system scoped rather
than project, so the token scope check deals with the required
target checking.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I1c74d772e33de9036037e767197a0bb15b127cd7

commit_message:
Additional IP addresses to IPv6 stateful ports

When network booting with DHCPv6-stateful we cannot
control the CLID/IAID used by the different clients,
UEFI, iPXE, Ironic IPA etc. Multiple IP address
reservation is required in the DHCPv6 server to avoid
NoAddrsAvail issues.

A new option to control the number of addresses to
allocate for IPv6 stateful ports created by Ironic
for provisioning, cleaning, rescuing etc is added.

Conflicts:
   ironic/conf/neutron.py
   ironic/tests/unit/common/test_neutron.py

NOTE: This backport differs from master. In master the
      default number of addresses is 4. In the train
      backport the default is 1, this is done to keep
      the default behaviour of the stable release as-is.

Story: 2007315
Task:  38820
Change-Id: I8c595830b8c7974c651a9e524b57a6540e4f3d1f
(cherry picked from commit cb3185274a76841b5e99ad0be6e3d8ef8c53f284)
(cherry picked from commit 855b654cb4b098d10c4d464fb1b116347af5e3b5)

commit_message:
Move expected commit & distro hash regex into repo-setup role vars

We use these a lot and are duplicating unnecessarily across
multiple files hurting  maintainability and making errors likely

This also adds the end line marker $ to tighten the regex as
discussed in [1] and ^$ for a full match on the aggregate hash

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/713753/3/roles/repo-setup/tasks/get-dlrn-hash.yml
Change-Id: I6f48aaf198cbfba8d8099c84aa3d769767bdd0ee

[{'created': '2020-04-10 09:21:06.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Switch to using sphinx-build, fix doc warnings
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine

Change-Id: I23a2d62a8853f01e8574ef37b5ee1ac2ee09acd0
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Switch to using sphinx-build, fix doc warnings
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine

Change-Id: I23a2d62a8853f01e8574ef37b5ee1ac2ee09acd0

commit_message:
[metadata agent] Account for 'external' ports

With the introduction of OVN 'external' ports, there can be
VIF ports that live in an external chassis. These should be
able to reach the metadata service so if an 'external' port
is bound to a hypervisor, metadata service will be provisioned
for it.

Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ib1c1eca68630f08de44aec29b6f6edac5e554f16
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit eb696ca703d1aaf168c54f37e0a25516e8953e5b)

commit_message:
Release final python-heatclient for ussuri

Final ussuri client lib release for the April 9 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: I997c92789b8a7bd388739c74058e77e65c8f8ad0
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add the ability to load vars from files

This change will provide the ability to load extra vars from files, instead
of having to pass options through the CLI parser. By loading vars from file
we can ensure options are made more safe and better handled, especially in
cases when a given option may be massive, as is the case with
`parameter_defaults`.

> A new argument has been added to the ansible playbook runner which will
  allow us to pass options into the method that will be stored in an
  extravars file, which is then dynamically loaded by ansible-runner.
  Information on extravars files can be seen here: [0].
> A test has been added to exercise the new extravars file capability.

[0]: https://ansible-runner.readthedocs.io/en/latest/intro.html#env-extravars

Closes-Bug: #1871338
Change-Id: I9675e587abf3f07e91319a40620a8f4c67fbf97b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Ensure netlink.nla_slot tuple key is a string

Ensure Pyroute2 netlink.nla_slot first element ("name"), is properly
converted to a string value. E.g.:
  In:  (b'IFA_ADDRESS', '192.168.30.20')
  Out: ('IFA_ADDRESS', '192.168.30.20')

Conflicts:
      neutron/privileged/agent/linux/ip_lib.py

Change-Id: I87efe6cf8734bae6523106944e99fbd7db9ef4d5
Related-Bug: #1846360
(cherry picked from commit 43e150e690538a509be8177353269787790ee143)
(cherry picked from commit c36867487454b4e01bece0a2769586884dbf379d)

commit_message:
[ZFSonLinux] Create share from snapshot in different backends

This patch improves the operation of create share from snapshot
to support different backends/hosts for the zfsonlinux driver

Partially-implements: bp create-share-from-snapshot-in-another-pool-or-backend

Depends-On: Iab13a0961eb4a387a502246e5d4b79bc9046e04b

Change-Id: I124803734c81d3630c5147f5f3bb75724489c929

subject: Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri
messages: [{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-04-10 17:07:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-10 16:15:04.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I20ac9bbce1d836dc49c21cb49db1a0b43ba2131f
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I20ac9bbce1d836dc49c21cb49db1a0b43ba2131f

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I8d24f3444dffa8f1b629e7a93cc5baac6e6d8e89
Sem-Ver: feature

subject: Cycle highlights for ironic-inspector
messages:
[{'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2020-04-08 13:52:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-04-09 07:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-09 20:30:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Cycle highlights are by team, not by deliverable. Not sure this is wanted. Not really clear without the context of seeing it here what this is actually referring to and what that would mean to end users and consumers of those highlight notes.'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2020-04-10 00:11:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-04-10 16:54:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Cycle highlights are by team, not by deliverable.

Oh. Then this is one of the things we want to improve. *makes a mental note to bring it on the thread about ironic future*'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-10 16:57:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

If you haven't seen it, this is the generated output that the marketing folks use:

https://releases.openstack.org/ussuri/highlights.html

This is just to help them as raw input into what they want to ultimately message for the coordinated release. This isn't like release notes (that's already well covered), so getting into the detail of what each deliverable includes is too granular for the target audience and purpose."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-04-10 16:59:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Maybe then separate the highlights from a deliverable? It feels weird to put ironic-inspector highlights into the ironic developer given that the two services are quite independent.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-10 17:16:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Maybe then separate the highlights from a deliverable? It feels
 > weird to put ironic-inspector highlights into the ironic developer
 > given that the two services are quite independent.

Yeah, it is a bit odd. The foundation people asked for help getting a way to collect this from the teams. This was the best mechanism we had without introducing an entirely new set of processes for everyone to follow.

Prior to this, direct calls were scheduled with each PTL to manually collect this type of information, which was obviously very time consuming. So although it isn't perfect, it has gone a long way to make it easier for everyone involved to get at least some of the right information into marketing hands to make sure what they are sharing publicly accurately reflects what the community has done."}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-26 21:53:27.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Allow versioned discovery unauthenticated

Make routes to the versioned discovery documents (/v2, /v2.1) go through
a paste pipeline that doesn't require authentication, while leaving
their sub-URLs (/v2.1/servers etc) requiring authentication.

Change-Id: Id47515017982850b167d5c637d93b96ae00ba793
Closes-Bug: #1845530
"}, {'created': '2019-09-27 20:07:40.000000000', 'message': 'Allow versioned discovery unauthenticated

Make routes to the versioned discovery documents (/v2, /v2.1) go through
a paste pipeline that doesn't require authentication, while leaving
their sub-URLs (/v2.1/servers etc) requiring authentication.

To make this work, our URLMap matcher gets support for a very
rudimentary wildcard syntax, whereby api-paste.ini can differentiate
between {/v2.1, /v2.1/} and /v2.1/$anything_else. The former points to
the unauthenticated discovery app pipeline; the latter points to the
existing "real API" pipeline. Similar for legacy v2.

While modifying the Versions resource it became clear that the 'multi'
path was unreachable, so it and its action method are removed.

Change-Id: Id47515017982850b167d5c637d93b96ae00ba793
Closes-Bug: #1845530
'}, {'created': '2019-09-30 19:38:08.000000000', 'message': 'Allow versioned discovery unauthenticated

Make routes to the versioned discovery documents (/v2, /v2.1) go through
a paste pipeline that doesn't require authentication, while leaving
their sub-URLs (/v2.1/servers etc) requiring authentication.

To make this work, our URLMap matcher gets support for a very
rudimentary wildcard syntax, whereby api-paste.ini can differentiate
between {/v2.1, /v2.1/} and /v2.1/$anything_else. The former points to
the unauthenticated discovery app pipeline; the latter points to the
existing "real API" pipeline. Similar for legacy v2.

This entails a slight behavior change: requests to /v2 and /v2.1 used to
302 redirect to /v2/ and /v2.1/, respectively. Now they just work.

Change-Id: Id47515017982850b167d5c637d93b96ae00ba793
Closes-Bug: #1845530

commit_message:
Allow versioned discovery unauthenticated

Make routes to the versioned discovery documents (/v2, /v2.1) go through
paste pipelines that don't require authentication, while leaving their
sub-URLs (/v2.1/servers etc) requiring authentication.

To make this work, our URLMap matcher gets support for a very
rudimentary wildcard syntax, whereby api-paste.ini can differentiate
between {/v2.1, /v2.1/} and /v2.1/$anything_else. The former points to
the unauthenticated discovery app pipeline; the latter points to the
existing "real API" pipeline. Similar for legacy v2.

This entails a slight behavior change: requests to /v2 and /v2.1 used to
302 redirect to /v2/ and /v2.1/, respectively. Now they just work.

Change-Id: Id47515017982850b167d5c637d93b96ae00ba793
Closes-Bug: #1845530
Closes-Bug: #1728732

commit_message:
Cap hacking for py2 support

This caps the version of hacking used, and the linters that it ends up
pulling in, to still work with python 2.

Updates the way requirements are installed for the pep8 job to pull in
all test-requirements.

Change-Id: Ifdcb3ca27c50a182c06d9bf39c518a24ea0b3472
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers

Change-Id: Id04f2ca5b879ee1f37cd349ff85ebec01389213a

subject: Drop dependencies from manage-projects
messages:
[{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-04-10 03:31:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-04-10 15:44:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The error is:

Unable to freeze job graph: Job infra-prod-remote-puppet-else depends on infra-prod-update-system-config which was not run.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-04-10 15:46:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2020-04-10 15:47:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-04-10 15:48:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-10 03:31:08.000000000', 'message': "Add infra-prod-update-system-config to deploy

The infra-prod-update-system-config job is a hard dependency to
run the infra-prod-remote-puppet-else job which we don't run inside
the post pipeline, this means that the job fails to run when we make
changes to zuul/main.yaml

This patch adds it so that it runs always in post, ideally, it should
run when specific files change _but_ that's an optimization that can
be left to someone who understands this better than I do. :)

Change-Id: I16bc248a1a370ab4819c8068e05bf6d15a3dd16b
"}, {'created': '2020-04-10 15:46:51.000000000', 'message': 'Drop dependencies from manage-projects

The parent job for manage-projects requires a dependency of updating
the system-config code which is not necessary when it runs in the
context of openstack/project-config.

Change-Id: I16bc248a1a370ab4819c8068e05bf6d15a3dd16b
'}]
commit_message:
Drop dependencies from manage-projects

The parent job for manage-projects requires a dependency of updating
the system-config code which is not necessary when it runs in the
context of openstack/project-config.

Change-Id: I16bc248a1a370ab4819c8068e05bf6d15a3dd16b

Didn't found major issues. I've addressed a single nit regarding your release note, but I'm ok with you solving that only if there is need to submit a new patch."}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2020-04-07 15:57:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(11 comments)

Mostly just nits and relatively superficial comments so far.

I do have a question about how we can actually know that all the asychronous status stuff on the netapp works and that error conditions, etc. are handled.  It seems to me that the tempest tests added probably will work for relatively simple netapp cluster topologies and for more complicated topologies without anyone being able to tell which was being tested :D

Maybe confidence on this stuff is gained entirely from unit tests, I'm mostly just thinking out loud.  Setting up the various NetApp variations would be pretty intensive."}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2020-04-07 17:37:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(6 comments)

> (11 comments)
 > 
 > Mostly just nits and relatively superficial comments so far.
 > 
 > I do have a question about how we can actually know that all the
 > asychronous status stuff on the netapp works and that error
 > conditions, etc. are handled.  It seems to me that the tempest
 > tests added probably will work for relatively simple netapp cluster
 > topologies and for more complicated topologies without anyone being
 > able to tell which was being tested :D
 > 
 > Maybe confidence on this stuff is gained entirely from unit tests,
 > I'm mostly just thinking out loud.  Setting up the various NetApp
 > variations would be pretty intensive.

Thanks for your review Tom.
I'll consider all of your comments for the next patch.

Yes, would be great to have more tempest tests added to cover all scenarios but this is one of the limitations that we found by creation shares from snapshot using the available APIs. We can force different pools but how this is going to be handled by the drivers/backends depends on how the infrastructure is configured. There are some backend info that we can't retrieve using the available APIs (e.g: cluster-name)
With the current tempest change, the upstream NetApp CI will be testing only the following scenarios:
 - different pools, same backend: volume move between different aggregates.
 - different azs: we configured our CI to work with one AZ per cluster, this will test the creation using snapmirror for data copy.
On our downstream ci we have the option of creating NetApp specific tests, like getting the cluster information for each backend before selecting the suitable destination. With this we were able to test the missing scenario: 
- different backends, same cluster: will trigger a volume rehost and, if needed, a volume move between aggregates. 

We were able to execute the same tests using NetApp scopped qos attributes [1].
Regarding the negative tests, it was implemented in a way that the temporary share is always deleted on any exception raised. But if the temporary share is already on its destination and fails, can be handled afterwards by the delete command, since it will be on 'error'.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/791755/"}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2020-04-09 03:34:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2020-04-09 03:37:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
[NetApp] Improve create share from snapshot functionality

This patch improves the operation of creating share from snapshot
to accept new destinations that can be different pools or
back ends.

Change-Id: Id3b3d5860d6325f368cbebfe7f97c98d64554d72

[{'created': '2020-03-18 18:39:59.000000000', 'message': "Add Octavia OVN Provider configuration (2 of 2)

This is part 2 of 2, where ovn provider info located in
tripleo::profile::base::octavia::api will move
to newly created octavia::provider::ovn.
But that has to be split into 2 parts to avoid breaking the
CI until the THT+pupple-tripleo changes merges [1].

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:bug/1861886+(status:open+OR+status:merged)

This patch enhances Octavia's OVN driver config, so it can connect to
OVN_Northbound DB using TLS.

commit_message:
Add Octavia OVN Provider configuration (2 of 2)

This is part 2 of 2, where ovn provider info located in
tripleo::profile::base::octavia::api will move
to newly created octavia::provider::ovn.
But that has to be split into 2 parts to avoid breaking the
CI until the THT+pupple-tripleo changes merges [1].

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:bug/1861886+(status:open+OR+status:merged)

This patch enhances Octavia's OVN driver config, so it can connect to
OVN_Northbound DB using TLS.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711333/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711557/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705728/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707695/

Closes-Bug: #1861886

Change-Id: If4a6f25015374883050c48b7705e8207906118f4

commit_message:
Add logic to clean up ipa on stack delete

Invoke a playbook to clean up hosts and services in FreeIPA when doing a
stack delete. This ensures we don't orphan objects in FreeIPA after the
stack is gone.

This playbook runs on the undercloud host. It doesn't run on any
overcloud instances or hosts.

Change-Id: I64889715218b3f51a485dbca94ab733410aa0178

commit_message:
Set dns_name propery on ports and networks

Neutron's dns_assignments field includes a nice pice of
structured data. This is a prerequirement for Designate
usage. (No plan's to use that, but being a bit ready
does'nt hurt.)

  {"hostname": "my-vm",
   "ip_address": "192.0.2.16",
   "fqdn": "my-vm.example.org."}

Enable for the undercloud:
 - dns_domain_ports ml2 extension driver

Change-Id: I46eb9a24dd66821b27524fe4d1fdab617b6fa948

Remove manifests for Trove

We don't support Trove in TripleO now, so these manifests can be
removed safely.

commit_message:
Add Python3 project templates for Victoria release

Following the process set down in the TC resolution on updating Python
versions:

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20181024-python-update-process.html

this change adds the Zuul template for Python 3 unit test jobs in the
Victoria release. The selected python versions are defined in:

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html

Change-Id: Ic872ab38568536f7bd25d593f80c2d6aa8379b01
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Revert "Enable ConfigDebug for undercloud deployments"

We don't need/want the ConfigDebug enabled by default, too verbose.

This reverts commit 7bef443b73046ba3f73f76d33adf721ea422af86.

Change-Id: I167d00ee812f8442a3f2294a2bdad01ec8a9c052

[{'created': '2020-04-08 23:45:06.000000000', 'message': 'Run ifup on a bond when a slave interface is restarted

This change adds the bond to the list of interfaces to be
restarted when a slave interface is restarted. On Fedora/CentOS
like systems restart all interface slaves in a bond, the bond
will be left in a downed state. This change runs ifup on the
bond if any slave interfaces are restarted, which insures that
the bond should be up in all cases when os-net-config exits.
Tests were added to ensure that in all cases each interface
or bond will only be restarted once, and that bonds will only
be restarted if the interface modifications require restart.

(cherry picked from commit fe13c4944be3221092f9147385700e4914a30cde)

commit_message:
Run ifup on a bond when a slave interface is restarted

This change adds the bond to the list of interfaces to be
restarted when a slave interface is restarted. On Fedora/CentOS
like systems restart all interface slaves in a bond, the bond
will be left in a downed state. This change runs ifup on the
bond if any slave interfaces are restarted, which insures that
the bond should be up in all cases when os-net-config exits.
Tests were added to ensure that in all cases each interface
or bond will only be restarted once, and that bonds will only
be restarted if the interface modifications require restart.

Change-Id: Ibbe8021afdc4772c6e2017d11d012b8f5c46d907
Closes-bug: 1870608
(cherry picked from commit fe13c4944be3221092f9147385700e4914a30cde)

commit_message:
Run ifup on a bond when a slave interface is restarted

This change adds the bond to the list of interfaces to be
restarted when a slave interface is restarted. On Fedora/CentOS
like systems restart all interface slaves in a bond, the bond
will be left in a downed state. This change runs ifup on the
bond if any slave interfaces are restarted, which insures that
the bond should be up in all cases when os-net-config exits.
Tests were added to ensure that in all cases each interface
or bond will only be restarted once, and that bonds will only
be restarted if the interface modifications require restart.

Change-Id: Ibbe8021afdc4772c6e2017d11d012b8f5c46d907
Closes-bug: 1870608
(cherry picked from commit fe13c4944be3221092f9147385700e4914a30cde)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-25 16:15:25.000000000', 'message': "Change way of retrieving LSP in virtual_port functional tests

Sometimes we had a situation, where Logical_Switch_Port type
received by IDL had a different type, that type set in the
NBDB. We changed the way we retrieve the LS from DB, to not
loop over rows in table, but call db_find_rows() instead.
With this change after about 40 retries of functional tests we
don't spot the same issue again.

(cherry-picked from neutron I07c081d1984b26a10a4d854d17117cfeaac7f8ac)

Change-Id: I4bc99bd3881251db0ea4d27e4c5e149c31edbd42
Co-Authored-By: Maciej Józefczyk <mjozefcz@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Change way of retrieving LSP in virtual_port functional tests

Sometimes we had a situation, where Logical_Switch_Port type
received by IDL had a different type, that type set in the
NBDB. We changed the way we retrieve the LS from DB, to not
loop over rows in table, but call db_find_rows() instead.
With this change after about 40 retries of functional tests we
don't spot the same issue again.

(cherry-picked from neutron I07c081d1984b26a10a4d854d17117cfeaac7f8ac)

Change-Id: I4bc99bd3881251db0ea4d27e4c5e149c31edbd42
Co-Authored-By: Maciej Józefczyk <mjozefcz@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

If we somehow have an empty set of addresses, lsp_set_addresses
will fail. This instead calls db_clear() on the addresses field if
we are trying to set it to empty.

(cherry-picked from Neutron Ied92eb85b74e63a7317d50970b5131fb49e3e4b0)

Change-Id: If4ca8b6ba75d5d7321cb9ad2c6a9293bd30b796d
Closes-bug: #1860560
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure we don't pass empty addresses to lsp_set_addresses

If we somehow have an empty set of addresses, lsp_set_addresses
will fail. This instead calls db_clear() on the addresses field if
we are trying to set it to empty.

(cherry-picked from Neutron Ied92eb85b74e63a7317d50970b5131fb49e3e4b0)

Change-Id: If4ca8b6ba75d5d7321cb9ad2c6a9293bd30b796d
Closes-bug: #1860560

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-08 22:55:16.000000000', 'message': 'Send writes to the cluster RW primary

Before this change, DB setup for client applications would occur on
whichever node was the juju leader. This may not be the cluster RW
primary node. This led to Bug #1866164.

This change guarantees that any post-clustering writes get sent to the
cluster RW primary node. It also makes the get_cluster_status method
more failure resistant.

Change-Id: If6beb4450be755a1b204c63759de32d486201202
Closes-Bug: #1866164
'}, {'created': '2020-04-09 16:59:34.000000000', 'message': 'Send writes to the cluster RW primary

Before this change, DB setup for client applications would occur on
whichever node was the juju leader. This may not be the cluster RW
primary node. This led to Bug #1866164.

This change guarantees that any post-clustering writes get sent to the
cluster RW primary node.

It also avoids race conditions during rolling restarts, when attempts to
connect to the DB during a topology change would lead to failures.

Change-Id: If6beb4450be755a1b204c63759de32d486201202
Closes-Bug: #1866164
'}, {'created': '2020-04-09 22:31:00.000000000', 'message': 'Send writes to the cluster RW primary

Before this change, DB setup for client applications would occur on
whichever node was the juju leader. This may not be the cluster RW
primary node. This led to Bug #1866164.

This change guarantees that any post-clustering writes get sent to the

Change-Id: If6beb4450be755a1b204c63759de32d486201202
Closes-Bug: #1866164
'}]
commit_message:
Send writes to the cluster RW primary

Before this change, DB setup for client applications would occur on
whichever node was the juju leader. This may not be the cluster RW
primary node. This led to Bug #1866164.

This change guarantees that any post-clustering writes get sent to the
cluster RW primary node.

Change-Id: If6beb4450be755a1b204c63759de32d486201202
Closes-Bug: #1866164

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8942016ef88695fb9c2fad14f179168a608e4af9

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie7e62fd485e509c3f7bb53fe47dd1bb66cdf7b0e

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Sem-Ver: feature

subject: Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri
messages: [{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-04-10 13:38:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-10 12:00:31.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia96dad55d1ff054d426e058f4722c7ce810f3020
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia96dad55d1ff054d426e058f4722c7ce810f3020

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: Ia550759b11f005fb8a2273a6aa668bb4edfe7537
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I08ed1d5594c44a2a37afe17c79f522b5de301baf

Update master for stable/ussuri

stable/ussuri.

automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on

It looks like the problem with the most recent build is that ceph-mgr failed the liveness/readiness test.  Not sure what's going on there: i doesn't happen on my testbed, and the manager seems to have come up OK the previous build (see here: http://logs.openstack.org/05/527505/70/check/openstack-helm-legacy-ubuntu-vm-ovs-radosgw/17e0b27/primary/k8s/pods/ceph-ceph-mgr-f99c4bd7d-bmqxg-ceph-mgr.txt), so it's not consistent.  It's possible that it's just slow in responding to the HTTP request, but relaxing liveness timeout doesn't seem like a proper fix."}, {'account_id': 26441, 'date': '2017-12-29 19:21:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 72.'}, {'account_id': 26201, 'date': '2017-12-29 19:25:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 72:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-12 19:41:56.000000000', 'message': 'Ceph OSD disk targeting

This allows users to configure ceph such that an OSD pod will
be created fror each device that is provided.

OSD devices and journals may be specified either using paths to
block device files or with SCSI paths of the form "scsi@x:y:z:n".
Journal devices may also have a partition specified either as
part of the device name or as a separate value.

The patch also updates liveness and readiness checks to be more
appropriate for an environment with multiple OSDs per host.

Change-Id: Ibbb535a8753b4bada49e4b0139489f5966854b5c
Signed-off-by: Ganesh Maharaj Mahalingam <ganesh.mahalingam@intel.com>

'}, {'created': '2017-12-14 20:35:32.000000000', 'message': 'Ceph OSD disk targeting

This allows users to configure ceph such that an OSD pod will
be created fror each device that is provided.

OSD devices and journals may be specified either using paths to
block device files or with SCSI paths of the form "scsi@x:y:z:n".
Journal devices may also have a partition specified either as
part of the device name or as a separate value.

The patch also updates liveness and readiness checks to be more
appropriate for an environment with multiple OSDs per host.

Change-Id: Ibbb535a8753b4bada49e4b0139489f5966854b5c
Signed-off-by: Ganesh Maharaj Mahalingam <ganesh.mahalingam@intel.com>

commit_message:
Ceph OSD disk targeting

This allows users to configure ceph such that an OSD pod will
be created fror each device that is provided.

OSD devices and journals may be specified either using paths to
block device files or with SCSI paths of the form "scsi@x:y:z:n".
Journal devices may also have a partition specified either as
part of the device name or as a separate value.

The patch also updates liveness and readiness checks to be more
appropriate for an environment with multiple OSDs per host.

Change-Id: Ibbb535a8753b4bada49e4b0139489f5966854b5c
Signed-off-by: Ganesh Maharaj Mahalingam <ganesh.mahalingam@intel.com>

(1 comment)

LGTM, want to use a repo that merges more changes than reno?'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-04-08 15:08:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Andreas Jaeger wrote:
> LGTM, want to use a repo that merges more changes than reno?

Maybe openstack/release-test would allow more flexibility as a test sandbox, since what you're really going to want to test out actively are corner cases like branch creation/deletion and tag propagation."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-04-09 13:45:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-04-09 13:46:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-04-09 14:36:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2020-04-10 00:03:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-04-10 08:46:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ah ok... My understanding after asking around was that the job (as defined) would only be available through openstack/project-config, so x/nova could be blocked there by openstack-infra reviewers... I may have understood wrong though.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-04-10 13:30:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Clark had suggested in IRC that it should be marked protected, I simply forgot that when reviewing your change. It needs to be added to projects in the config repo for other reasons though, related to implicit branch matchers and a desire to have it running on tag events for branched repositories.'}]

[{'created': '2020-04-08 14:48:13.000000000', 'message': 'Introduce job for granular GitHub mirroring

Create a openstack-mirror-on-github job that uses the
openstack-mirroring user on GitHub (and its SSH key) to
individually mirror repositories to the "openstack"
organization on GitHub.

That will allow us to turn off global replication of the
'openstack/* repositories at Gerrit-level.

Enable the new job on openstack/reno as a test. It should be
able to run concurrently with Gerrit-wide mirroring as this
is an indempotent operation.

Once this merges and is validated, we can apply the job to
all official/active openstack projects, before disabling the
Gerrit-wide replication (see https://review.opendev.org/718478).

Change-Id: Ie7b4f520d6f47d56a71c812dcc06fd5d26da8fe0

commit_message:
Introduce job for granular GitHub mirroring

Create a openstack-mirror-on-github job that uses the
openstack-mirroring user on GitHub (and its SSH key) to
individually mirror repositories to the "openstack"
organization on GitHub.

That will allow us to turn off global replication of the
'openstack/* repositories at Gerrit-level.

Enable the new job on openstack/release-test as a test. It
should be able to run concurrently with Gerrit-wide
mirroring as this is an indempotent operation.

Once this merges and is validated, we can apply the job to
all official/active openstack projects, before disabling the
Gerrit-wide replication (see https://review.opendev.org/718478).

Change-Id: Ie7b4f520d6f47d56a71c812dcc06fd5d26da8fe0

commit_message:
Fix amphora image build jobs

The amphora image build jobs are python3. Installing python-yaml
(python 2) causes trouble.

Change-Id: I1d591dda5fbb7aaea4d51da5a1d2218114051f36

commit_message:
Add ceph config overrides support

This change adds ceph config overrides support by
moving the logic from tht to tripleo-ansible.
This allow us to avoid centralizing all the
variables in ceph-base.yml, distributing them to
the related templates.
The logic implemented here just merge the provided
structures, maintaining backward compatibility with
the old used "key:value" pattern without a specific
section (which use global by default).

Closes-Bug: #1867006
Change-Id: Idbe0a6526fa262121bbb424f8705a3664ea00abd

commit_message:
Pick stale amphora randomly

Avoid getting the same amphora all the time if its loadbalancer
stuck in PENDING state and could not be failovered.

Story: 2007340
Task: 38877

Change-Id: I2f680a00be695c3828166e6803882765af79b79e
(cherry picked from commit 0f7d03feca4e3a4796c9c1a5a55d8da2adc44ebd)

commit_message:
[doc] Images need some metadata for software RAID

This is a follow-up for change #686580 to add some docs on the need
for image metadata when deploying with software RAID.

Change-Id: Iabc7e5482049df7aa6933053576ceb3f55e251b4
Story: #2006649
Task: #37081

Rest of docs look good to me, and the code in the manila repo as well. Thanks Carlos!'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-04-03 19:18:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Thanks for working on this Carlos, and sorry I couldn't get to this earlier - have you read this? https://docs.openstack.org/manila/queens/contributor/experimental_apis.html#when-do-i-need-to-remove-the-experimental-annotation-from-an-api

You'll need to bump the API microversion when you drop the experimental flag from each of these APIs, as per that spec linked above. 

The main problem with just dropping the experimental flag from an older microversion is with breaking the client contract. If someone, theoretically writes a piece of code to run on manila universally, that code isn't portable - lets say Cloud A upgrades to Ussuri, but Cloud B doesn't - application consumers have to always include the Experimental API header on Cloud B, but, they don't *need* to on Cloud A - that's inconsistent behavior, for the same API version."}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-04-07 05:32:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

> (5 comments)
 > 
 > LGTM, thanks Carlos -

 > This patch will be in conflict with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/709697/
 > - So please rebase on top of that patch if that's merging earlier..
 > 
 > The pylint errors are a pain, if you can please address them..

Hey, Goutham! Thanks for revisiting. I agree with you that this pylint issues are a pain. I have searched for more occurrences of this, in order to check if there is some way to solve this issue and relized that we have few others in the API.
I have tried to fix this locally by not breaking the function declaration into two lines, but when I've done this the pylint disable comment was exceeding the 79 characters limit and breaking pep8 even if I renamed the method with a shorter name. Can you think of any other way I can solve this?"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-04-09 15:00:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)

> Hey, Goutham! Thanks for revisiting. I agree with you that this pylint issues are a pain. I have searched for more occurrences of this, in order to check if there is some way to solve this issue and relized that we have few others in the API.
> I have tried to fix this locally by not breaking the function declaration into two lines, but when I've done this the pylint disable comment was exceeding the 79 characters limit and breaking pep8 even if I renamed the method with a shorter name. Can you think of any other way I can solve this?

Yes, I've left a comment inline in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/706959/6/manila/api/v2/share_group_snapshots.py

We can choose to do disable/re-enable if it is worth doing; I don't have a strong position on this - these API files will have redefined functions intentionally, I wonder if there's a way to globally ignore that check on the API files, we can investigate that in another change.."}, {'account_id': 29632, 'date': '2020-04-09 17:05:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 29632, 'date': '2020-04-09 17:08:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

commit_message:
Remove experimental flag from share groups feature

This patch updates the share groups APIs to be no longer considered
as experimental. It is done by removing the experimental flag from
the share groups, share group snapshots, share group extra specs
and share group types requests.

DocImpact
Partially-Implements: bp graduate-share-groups-feature
Change-Id: I080683541d527657f01008d43529fc53c19a09cd

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-06 05:39:04.000000000', 'message': "Reset the cell cache for database access in Service

We have had a gate bug for a long time where occasionally the scheduler
service gets into a state where many requests fail in it with
CellTimeout errors. Example:

  Timed out waiting for response from cell <cell uuid>

Through the use of much DNM patch debug logging in oslo.db, it was
revealed that service child processes (workers) were sometimes starting
off with already locked internal oslo.db locks. This can occur due to a
python issue [1] where if a parent process forks a child process while
a lock is held, the child will inherit the held lock which can never be
acquired. Standard library locks are not sanitized upon fork (yet).

The python issue is being worked on upstream but in the meantime (and
if the fix doesn't end up being backported all the way to python 3.6),
we can handle this issue by clearing the cell cache that holds oslo.db
database transaction context manager objects during service start().
This way, we get fresh oslo.db locks that are in an unlocked state when
a child process begins.

We can also take this opportunity to resolve part of a TODO to clear
the same cell cache during service reset() (SIGHUP) since it is another
case where we intended to clear it.

Closes-Bug: #1844929

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue40089

Change-Id: Id233f673a57461cc312e304873a41442d732c051
"}, {'created': '2020-04-08 03:20:43.000000000', 'message': 'Reset the cell cache for database access in Service

We have had a gate bug for a long time where occasionally the scheduler
service gets into a state where many requests fail in it with
CellTimeout errors. Example:

  Timed out waiting for response from cell <cell uuid>

revealed that service child processes (workers) were sometimes starting
off with already locked internal oslo.db locks. This is a known issue
in python [1] where if a parent process forks a child process while a
lock is held, the child will inherit the held lock which can never be
acquired.

The python issue is not considered a bug and the recommended way to
handle it is by making use of the os.register_at_fork() in the oslo.db
to reinitialize its lock. The method is new in python 3.7, so as long
as we still support python 3.6, we must handle the situation outside of
oslo.db.

We can do this by clearing the cell cache that holds oslo.db database
transaction context manager objects during service start(). This way,
we get fresh oslo.db locks that are in an unlocked state when a child
process begins.

We can also take this opportunity to resolve part of a TODO to clear
the same cell cache during service reset() (SIGHUP) since it is another
case where we intended to clear it.

Closes-Bug: #1844929

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue6721

Change-Id: Id233f673a57461cc312e304873a41442d732c051

to reinitialize its lock. The method is new in python 3.7, so as long

oslo.db.

We can do this by clearing the cell cache that holds oslo.db database
transaction context manager objects during service start(). This way,
we get fresh oslo.db locks that are in an unlocked state when a child
process begins.

the same cell cache during service reset() (SIGHUP) since it is another
case where we intended to clear it. The rest of the TODO related to
periodic clearing of the cache is removed after discussion on the
review, as such clearing would be unsynchronized among multiple
services and for periods of time each service might have a different

commit_message:
Reset the cell cache for database access in Service

We have had a gate bug for a long time where occasionally the scheduler
service gets into a state where many requests fail in it with
CellTimeout errors. Example:

  Timed out waiting for response from cell <cell uuid>

Through the use of much DNM patch debug logging in oslo.db, it was
revealed that service child processes (workers) were sometimes starting
off with already locked internal oslo.db locks. This is a known issue
in python [1] where if a parent process forks a child process while a
lock is held, the child will inherit the held lock which can never be
acquired.

The python issue is not considered a bug and the recommended way to
handle it is by making use of the os.register_at_fork() in the oslo.db
to reinitialize its lock. The method is new in python 3.7, so as long
as we still support python 3.6, we must handle the situation outside of
oslo.db.

We can do this by clearing the cell cache that holds oslo.db database
transaction context manager objects during service start(). This way,
we get fresh oslo.db locks that are in an unlocked state when a child
process begins.

We can also take this opportunity to resolve part of a TODO to clear
the same cell cache during service reset() (SIGHUP) since it is another
case where we intended to clear it. The rest of the TODO related to
periodic clearing of the cache is removed after discussion on the
review, as such clearing would be unsynchronized among multiple
services and for periods of time each service might have a different
view of cached cells than another.

Closes-Bug: #1844929

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue6721

Change-Id: Id233f673a57461cc312e304873a41442d732c051

commit_message:
Add new parameter NovaSchedulePlacementAggregateRequiredForTenants

Add new paramter NovaSchedulePlacementAggregateRequiredForTenants
allows for configuring scheduler to enable tenant-isolation with
placement, which controls whether or not a tenant with no aggregate
affinity will be allowed to schedule to any available node.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717746/
Change-Id: Id61deee3ec2981b2caddd07b06bef0b701e40ac2
(cherry picked from commit 148185cada9fef9c8baa4494538c6f64b074dbee)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-08 23:50:52.000000000', 'message': 'Run ifup on a bond when a slave interface is restarted

This change adds the bond to the list of interfaces to be
restarted when a slave interface is restarted. On Fedora/CentOS
like systems restart all interface slaves in a bond, the bond
will be left in a downed state. This change runs ifup on the
bond if any slave interfaces are restarted, which insures that
the bond should be up in all cases when os-net-config exits.
Tests were added to ensure that in all cases each interface
or bond will only be restarted once, and that bonds will only
be restarted if the interface modifications require restart.

Change-Id: Ibbe8021afdc4772c6e2017d11d012b8f5c46d907
Closes-bug: 1870608
(cherry picked from commit fe13c4944be3221092f9147385700e4914a30cde)
'}]
commit_message:
Run ifup on a bond when a slave interface is restarted

This change adds the bond to the list of interfaces to be
restarted when a slave interface is restarted. On Fedora/CentOS
like systems restart all interface slaves in a bond, the bond
will be left in a downed state. This change runs ifup on the
bond if any slave interfaces are restarted, which insures that
the bond should be up in all cases when os-net-config exits.
Tests were added to ensure that in all cases each interface
or bond will only be restarted once, and that bonds will only
be restarted if the interface modifications require restart.

Change-Id: Ibbe8021afdc4772c6e2017d11d012b8f5c46d907
Closes-bug: 1870608
(cherry picked from commit fe13c4944be3221092f9147385700e4914a30cde)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-07 20:00:44.000000000', 'message': "WIP Move the haproxy iptables rules creation to host_prep_tasks

The reason for this is that under deploy_tasks they won't be run during
an update (until the converge command is run). This is problematic
because in a composable HA being updated the haproxy firewall rules
might disappear due to other tasks cleaning the rules up and they won't
be recreated until converge. The problem is that that the temporary
containers will run during the minor update and try to access the db
which is now effectively firewalled off.

Historically this was at step 2, because haproxy was configured during
that step. Nothing should prevent us from creating the rules before and
that is what we do for the non-haproxy rules too anyway.

NB: Cherry pick not clean due to context

Change-Id: Icba8a8292d1e2675c7da3513d00a4a0f4191747e
(cherry picked from commit 24d3a25f397d39efd5b8c2399644d80dfc1f82d4)

because in a composable HA being updated the haproxy firewall rules

1) Deployed a fresh Train environment with this patch and correctly

[root@controller-0 ~]# iptables -nvL INPUT |grep _haproxy |wc -l

(in that order) and verified that afterwards all _haproxy rules
are in place *before* the converge.

haproxy rules are enforced (previously this was not the case):
$ grep 'Run puppet on the host to apply IPtables rules' update-controller-2.log
TASK [Run puppet on the host to apply IPtables rules] **************************

4) Run a full minor update + converge of a composable HA environment

NB: Cherry-pick not 100% clean due to context

Closes-Bug: #1871646

Change-Id: Icba8a8292d1e2675c7da3513d00a4a0f4191747e
(cherry picked from commit 6220fe1bd319b8fabcc46b4b3fc705ac2f5526ed)

commit_message:
Move the haproxy iptables rules creation to host_prep_tasks

The reason for this is that under deploy_tasks they won't be run during
an update (until the converge command is run). This is problematic
because in a composable HA being updated the haproxy firewall rules
might disappear due to other tasks cleaning the rules up and they won't
be recreated until converge. The problem is that that the temporary
containers will run during the minor update and try to access the db
which is now effectively firewalled off.

Historically this was at step 2, because haproxy was configured during
that step. Nothing should prevent us from creating the rules before and
that is what we do for the non-haproxy rules too anyway.

While moving it we need to take out the code from
::tripleo::profile::base::haproxy and use it directly because we do not
have the required 'step' variable set in host_prep_tasks and silly
puppet has now way of passing a hiera value on the command line (or via
other simple means)

Tested as follows:
1) Deployed a fresh Train environment with this patch and correctly
observed the haproxy fw rules:
[root@controller-0 ~]# iptables -nvL INPUT |grep _haproxy |wc -l
27

2) Ran a minor update of controller-2, controller-1 and controller-0
(in that order) and verified that afterwards all _haproxy rules
are in place *before* the converge.

3) Confirmed that in the minor update logs we do see the step where
haproxy rules are enforced (previously this was not the case):
$ grep 'Run puppet on the host to apply IPtables rules' update-controller-2.log
TASK [Run puppet on the host to apply IPtables rules] **************************

4) Run a full minor update + converge of a composable HA environment

NB: Cherry-pick not 100% clean due to context

Closes-Bug: #1871646

Change-Id: Icba8a8292d1e2675c7da3513d00a4a0f4191747e
(cherry picked from commit 6220fe1bd319b8fabcc46b4b3fc705ac2f5526ed)

commit_message:
Skip both tenant and management networks when generating certs

Without this change we were unable to deploy TLS Everywhere with
management network. This is because the service principal is not
created due to VIP being set to false in network_data.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1861097
Resolves: rhbz#1777605
Change-Id: I43fd5f67c1a0be6eaa1752575349e64329cada4a
(cherry picked from commit a22c04c576ce6956d4ca526b60b482501228f47e)

commit_message:
Use internal interface for keystone in "wait for placement" script

Instead of trying to go to the "admin" endpoint, which is
keystoneclient's default. We instead try to use the internal endpoint.

This reduces our usage of the keystone admin endpoint.

Change-Id: Ib2fe159d6e2503db834ae68d9a60c627a15b7b5e
(cherry picked from commit 55188215d9745fd8da5ae360b9ff26fb1d34253c)

commit_message:
Use internal interface for keystone in "wait for placement" script

Instead of trying to go to the "admin" endpoint, which is
keystoneclient's default. We instead try to use the internal endpoint.

This reduces our usage of the keystone admin endpoint.

Change-Id: Ib2fe159d6e2503db834ae68d9a60c627a15b7b5e
(cherry picked from commit 55188215d9745fd8da5ae360b9ff26fb1d34253c)

commit_message:
Create share from snapshot in another pool or backend

This patch enables the creation of a share from snapshot
specifying another pool or backend. In the scheduler, a
new filter and weigher were implemented in order to consider
this operation if the backend supports it. Also, a new
field called 'progress' was added in the share and share
instance. The 'progress' field indicates the status
of the operation create share from snapshot (in percentage).
Finally, a new periodic task was added in order to constantly
check the share status.

Partially-implements: bp create-share-from-snapshot-in-another-pool-or-backend

DOCImpact
Change-Id: Iab13a0961eb4a387a502246e5d4b79bc9046e04b
Co-authored-by: carloss <ces.eduardo98@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: dviroel <viroel@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add federated support for updating a user

This patch adds functionality to allow an operator to pass in a
federated attribute when updating a user. When a user is updated
the federated objects in the federated attribute will be updated
and associated along with the user.

Co-Authored-By: Kristi Nikolla <knikolla@bu.edu>

Partial-Bug: 1816076
Change-Id: I8ee43b437b551858c198320204b768cdba311506

commit_message:
Add federated support for creating a user

This patch adds functionality to allow an operator to pass in a
federated attribute when creating a user. When a user is created
the federated objects in the federated attribute will be created
and associated along with the user.

Co-Authored-By: Kristi Nikolla <knikolla@bu.edu>

Partial-Bug: 1816076
Change-Id: I6db03af81099a7509635881f05adf5a7257466a7

commit_message:
Add private parameter for runtime creation

The --private parameter is optional paramter
for runtime creation. This parameter makes
the runtime private. The runtime is public
by default.

Change-Id: I4f2b57ff140410a49f49f01d7af28b9e8fded8ec
Story: 2005919
Task: 34180

Hi Richard. Thanks for the patch. Can you add a release note for this change.'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2018-10-07 15:27:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review-1

Sorry to be a killjoy here, but I missed the whole spec for http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/backlog/support-federated-attr.html

And it has some fundamental problems.  I think we need to sync up before we continue.

"Creating" a Federated user, while tempting, is going to change the workflow for  multi-site.  There is a parallel effort to make the userids "predictable"   https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605169/  which needs to got in before "create"

As for "get"  the unique Id is not sufficient.  You are always going to need the idp and protocol.  The unique id is also not guaranteed to be URL safe, and thus would have to be encoded.  Due to the different form of the query, I think this API needs to be under something like /federated and not under /user.'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2018-10-08 17:55:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-10-19 00:36:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-10-22 21:02:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I think we need to discuss the specification a bit more, which is in backlog [0] before we merge this.

commit_message:
Add federated support for get user

This patch adds functionality to get_user that allows it to pull all
associated federated objects and tack it on to be displayed to the
user.

Partial-Bug: 1816076
Change-Id: I8d69ef68153d6650652e1081e5e7b9e5e31a3ed1

the containers does not need having /etc/timezone as we will mount it from the host. I will also add a precheck for the host.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-01-31 13:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

what now? deprecate c8? :-)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-03 09:59:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

> what now? deprecate c8? :-)

Looks like /etc/timezone is a Debian thing. Do we need to wrap these in if base_distro in ['debian', 'ubuntu'], and ensure we ignore empty lines? Maybe make a variable for that expression."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-03 10:06:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

> > what now? deprecate c8? :-)
 > 
 > Looks like /etc/timezone is a Debian thing. Do we need to wrap
 > these in if base_distro in ['debian', 'ubuntu'], and ensure we
 > ignore empty lines? Maybe make a variable for that expression.

So those affected services will never work in CentOS? Maybe it's the wrong approach altogether then... ;/"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-03 11:15:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

> > > what now? deprecate c8? :-)
 > >
 > > Looks like /etc/timezone is a Debian thing. Do we need to wrap
 > > these in if base_distro in ['debian', 'ubuntu'], and ensure we
 > > ignore empty lines? Maybe make a variable for that expression.
 > 
 > So those affected services will never work in CentOS? Maybe it's
 > the wrong approach altogether then... ;/

The function that fails is datetime.astimezone(). Hopefully it would support both distros."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-03 11:41:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

> > > > what now? deprecate c8? :-)
 > > >
 > > > Looks like /etc/timezone is a Debian thing. Do we need to wrap
 > > > these in if base_distro in ['debian', 'ubuntu'], and ensure we
 > > > ignore empty lines? Maybe make a variable for that expression.
 > >
 > > So those affected services will never work in CentOS? Maybe it's
 > > the wrong approach altogether then... ;/
 > 
 > The function that fails is datetime.astimezone(). Hopefully it
 > would support both distros.

Hmm, I tried to break it on Ubuntu by removing/mangling /etc/timezone but it seemingly kept using /etc/localtime - could be python version dependent... So far we got it reported for Stein Ubuntu source version."}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2020-04-03 11:42:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

I am not sure about CentOS but /etc/timezone is a systemd thing on Debian and Ubuntu.

If base_distro in... makes sense to me. It is safe as we already ignore empty lines.

I will propose the new change for Debian and Ubuntu and in the meantime I will test watcher and freezer on CentOS 8.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-03 11:54:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

> I am not sure about CentOS but /etc/timezone is a systemd thing on
 > Debian and Ubuntu.
 > 
 > If base_distro in... makes sense to me. It is safe as we already
 > ignore empty lines.
 > 
 > I will propose the new change for Debian and Ubuntu and in the
 > meantime I will test watcher and freezer on CentOS 8.

Yeah, it would be good to know it works on CentOS as well.'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2020-04-05 18:48:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2020-04-06 05:30:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-06 18:13:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

style fixes and we are golden'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-09 18:53:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Published edit on patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-09 18:53:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2

did them for you!'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2020-04-10 01:26:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28614, 'date': '2020-04-10 05:28:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2020-04-10 09:30:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Introduce /etc/timezone to Debian/Ubuntu containers

Some services look for /etc/timezone on Debian/Ubuntu, so we should
introduce it to the containers.

In addition, added prechecks for /etc/localtime and /etc/timezone.

Closes-Bug: #1821592
Change-Id: I9fef14643d1bcc7eee9547eb87fa1fb436d8a6b3

commit_message:
Promote tempest and fullstack uwsgi jobs to be voting

Those 2 jobs are pretty stable since long time so we can make them
to be voting now.
Job 'neutron-functional-with-uwsgi' also follows 'neutron-functional'
job's failure rate but both jobs still needs some more stabilization
before we will make it voting.

This patch also moves some jobs to group similar jobs together.

Change-Id: Icb32776198f9b7fc6adfa287081e3feb4297116d

commit_message:
Expiring Group Memberships API - Allow set idp authorization_ttl

This patch extends the identity provider API to receive, return
and set the authorization_ttl on an identity provider.

Change-Id: I3c58da290d52149e307280042ed20447da4687f7
Partial-Bug: 1809116

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-07 14:17:46.000000000', 'message': 'Add new composable service for IpaClient

This new role is used to register nodes as ipa-clients and
configure the services required in IPA using ansible, rather
than using novajoin.  This is required on the standalone
environment, where there is no novajoin. It will also be the
implementation used when nova is removed from the undercloud
and for pre-provisioned nodes. The existing IpaClient
composable service will be removed in a future release.

This code replaces the server ipaclient-baremetal-ansible by using
a role from freeipa-ansible to register the nodes (controllers,
computes) as ipa-clients.

In external_tasks, the host entry is created and an otp is stored
as a host variable.  In deploy_step_tasks, this otp is used to
register the node. The IPA configuration tasks are delegated to
http://opendev.org/x/tripleo-ipa roles.

Co-Authored-By: Grzegorz Grasza <xek@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7dcd4608d3998596c2e4da19a8eca0d48e1fa841
(cherry picked from commit ae68c90b92cbd57e5e69ee13cef1110c72882873)

commit_message:
Add new composable service for IpaClient

This new role is used to register nodes as ipa-clients and
configure the services required in IPA using ansible, rather
than using novajoin.  This is required on the standalone
environment, where there is no novajoin. It will also be the
implementation used when nova is removed from the undercloud
and for pre-provisioned nodes. The existing IpaClient
composable service will be removed in a future release.

This code replaces the server ipaclient-baremetal-ansible by using
a role from freeipa-ansible to register the nodes (controllers,
computes) as ipa-clients.

In external_tasks, the host entry is created and an otp is stored
as a host variable.  In deploy_step_tasks, this otp is used to
register the node. The IPA configuration tasks are delegated to
http://opendev.org/x/tripleo-ipa roles.

Co-Authored-By: Grzegorz Grasza <xek@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7dcd4608d3998596c2e4da19a8eca0d48e1fa841
(cherry picked from commit ae68c90b92cbd57e5e69ee13cef1110c72882873)

commit_message:
Microversion 2.86 - Extra spec validation

This microversion introduces extra spec validation within the API.

No changes are required within novaclient so this change only bumps
API_MAX_VERSION.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708436/

Change-Id: Ic8fef7ee363435e9ac728b87d494593fcc6defc0
